title: Nourishing, Organic Cream from California!
text: Vitamin C is definitely an essential component of a healthy body and skincare routine, and I love that this smooth cream also contains shea butter, vitamin E oil, rosemary, jojoba oil, aloe vera, cocoa butter, and lavender essential oil. This lotion has a pleasant scent, and it seems to work great with overnight applications. It leaves my skin feeling hydrated and moisturized the next morning, and it has even helped diminish the appearance of minor blemishes over time. I love that this product is USDA-certified organic and that it’s made in small batches in the USA! The tub comes adequately sealed with a clearly marked expiration date, and I think it’s affordably priced for the results it provides. 🌤

title: Decent mascara but VERY hard pokey applicator!
text:
I have pretty long and decently full eyelashes so this mascara worked well for me as a daily mascara.

Cute packaging, nice slim shape with cute design.

I didn't find it to be too volumizing, but it does a good job at defining and lengthening.

Formula was not very wet from first opening so this may dry out faster than others if not used up.

My main issue with this mascara is the hard plastic applicator. It has longer and shorter hard bristles along the sides. I'm by no means a beginner with mascara, but for some reason I've poked my eye with this mascara applicator a couple of times already. The bristles just seem really hard and sharp!

This could just be me having a problem for whatever reason, but thought I'd mention.

Hope this review is helpful!

title: After Bath Skin Treat
text:
Body butter is the perfect after-bath treat for your skin. Zia body butter is a combination of shea butter and mango butter blended into a smooth moisturizer that could become a hand cream essential. (The small sample container in the Spa To Go kits fits nicely in your purse.)

This cream is super luxurious to use in the winter. This is one of the few products with myrrh essential oil.

Ingredients: Infusion of organic aloe vera extract, organic ginko biloba extract, organic elder extract, organic chamomile extract, caprylic/capric triglyceride, stearic acid, glycerin, glyceryl stearate, safflower oil, shea butter, mango butter, polysorbate 60, stearyl alcohol, sweet almond oil, tocopherol, beta carotene, rosehip seed oil, cucumber extract, green tea extract, algae extract, sodium carbomer, lavender essential oil, myrrh essential oil, neroli essential oil, vetiver essential oil, benzoin gum, phenoxyethanol, methylparaben, propylparaben.

Zia body butter is a rich moisturizing cream that absorbs fast and leaves your skin looking smooth and deeply moisturized. Using this product after the brown sugar body buff and Lavender Clary Sage Body Wash takes smooth skin to entirely new levels. If you use these three products and take a salt bath, then you may reach spa nirvana.

~The Rebecca Review

text:

Mirror is light weight yet the base is heavy. The mirror does turn over to have normal side then to flip it is magnified. The best part of this mirror is it is LED illuminated. It took 3 AA batteries which were supplied. The toggle switch is on the base and when illuminated it gives that cool glow. I love plucking my eyebrows with this mirror. Easy to see and with the added light it works well. The light is very vibrant and puts off a very nice glow. Lights are on both sides.
I would consider all materials high quality by the apperance and by the weight.

Overall I am extremely satisfied with this dual sided mirror. It has been a great item added to my makeup collection. Works well to sit on the vanity to give you an additional mirror for up close application and for the magnification. I am not sure how I have lived my 32 years without a mirror like this to apply my makeup or pluck my eyebrows.

I received this mirror for free for testing and reviewing purposes. This is my honest unbiased opinion and have come to it by using this mirror myself.

title: Nice look; feels pretty solid; but average in performance & value
text:
This is a “dressed up” version of the Wahl “LifeProof” shaver (which I also reviewed). It has a more upscale look and feel to it, plus adds a battery gauge to show the charge level. However, the shave quality is the same – OK, but not a standout.

The case feels more solid than the LifeProof and, while it’s more of a traditional look, I think they did a nice job with the overall aesthetics. It is pretty grippy even with wet hands. It does not, however, feel as comfortable to hold as the more sculpted models such as most of the Panasonic shavers and some Braun shavers.

The shave quality of this model is identical to that of the LifeProof: very Remington in how it feels (close, but rather aggressive). Performance is best on the easy spots (cheek) but not as good on the more trickier spots (neck and jawline). The flex head helps with dealing with face contours but it lacks enough travel to do an excellent quality job.

The aggressiveness of the shave is dialed down when using it wet. It needs a very, very thin layer of shave cream (the gel style creams work well) or the head gets bogged down.

Love the trimmer! The positioning could be improved to make it easier to use, but it cuts very cleanly on sideburns and ‘shash trimming.

The controls are clean, easy to read and tell you all you need to know (charge and battery status).

I like the feel of this better than the Wahl LifeProof, but the shave quality keeps this at the same rating (average, which is 3 stars). It’s a very workable shaver, but for the price there are better choices available from Panasonic (anything in their Arc line) or, for less money, from Remington.

title: The best.
text:
After having used this product for a month, I find myself hooked. As YMMV when taking someone's word on shave gear, I thought I might provide some background about me: I have gentle to oily skin and stiff, tough neck hairs. I used to think I had sensitive skin until I married someone with actual sensitive skin. But the combination of the tough hairs and the gentleness of my skin leads to irritation on the neck when I am not careful. I learned to shave with a gillette adjustable years ago(which I still use), but out of "convenience" (really, a lack of good shaving products and knowhow) I stopped using it for cartridge systems in my early twenties. Since I started shaving right, some time ago, I got an EJ-89 which I use when I'm feeling raw, and an old type open comb gillette (which, for the moment at least, I favor for its closeness- I use personna lab blue blades or sharper in it). I've tried a number of different soaps and a few creams, most of which are good. Mitchell's is excellent. It has a simple, clean smell like fresh linen and is the most thoroughly hydrating shaving product I have ever used. It lathers up easily- I've used my beat up old drugstore boar brush which is now probly 15 years old and a silvertip badger brush.. In either case, the lather whips up in a minute or less with no complications. I'm not one of these people that soaks the puck either, I just heat it up in its dish, in a basin of hot water as I soak my brush and it is good to go. I've heard that water hardness and temp can make a difference with this stuff, but as I have decidedly soft water here in the city, I can't really comment on that. But once you get the lather right, with enough water, it is eaaasy on the face. Amazing even.. I dreamt wetshaving was like this as a teenager..
One might be put off by the price which may seem hefty for a newcomer to the wetshaving game, eager to start saving money (previously lost on walking the cartridge treadmill) and reticent to buy apparently expensive luxury shaving soaps, but aside from being a quality product, It lasts for a quite a while. I was really going to wait until I had exhausted mine to write this review but it's been a month, and the puck looks basically the same size! Growing up on Williams soap and favoring Van der Hagen as a drugstore standby these days, I notice one soap generally lasts me a month (some less than that), but aside from the simply larger size of Mitchells (4.4 oz to 2.5 oz for standard mug size soaps), you just get more bang for your buck. I'm guessing this one will last me three months or more.. So at that rate, the price basically factors out altogether.
To sum up, if you have gentle or easily irritated skin and aren't looking for a heavily scented product, this is the grail of soaps for you. One word: I wouldn't spring for the dish because I am cheap. You might not be.. But the soap itself does perfectly fit a rice bowl or large ramekin, in case you were wondering.. Probably not a mug though, unless it were seriously oversized..

title: Excellent disposable wax treatment
text:
This is an excellent portable paraffin wax treatment. I really love how it makes my hands feel really silky and smooth. I can't really do anything when these are on my hands, but they feel nice and I like relaxing with them. Also, the black heart on the outside actually turns red when the wax gets really hot. I used mine in the microwave, and it worked really well.

They have a unique design, which is basically a plastic hand wrapper that has a spongy interior, and the sponge holds all of the paraffin wax so that it delivers it right to your hands. It also stays hot for a pretty long time, which surprised me that all the heat didn't dissipate really quickly.

These are made for average hands, so if your hands are giant, then these might be hard to fit into. But, they should work pretty well for most hands. Also, they're great for the first treatment, but for subsequent treatments, it's really tough to keep the wax in the sleeve while microwaving.

But, overall, they're awesome for disposable paraffin treatments.

Pros:
+Makes your hands feel silky smooth
+The spongy interior absorbs and holds most of the wax
+The heat indicator really works

Cons:
-May not last a full five treatments

*TGN gave me this wax to review*

text:
Great stuff. I have a long beard that is about 50% grey. The grey hair is coarser and less manageable than the hair that still has color. I use a little balm every day, and it has made the beard look better and feel less dry.

I'm not usually interested in grooming products, but as the beard gets greyer and longer, it was becoming apparent that it needed a little help. I think in the old days our viking ancestors oiled their beards, so I think we can use the balm and still be squared-away.

The balm is easy to use, makes no mess, and has no noticeable smell. All upside, no problems. I keep a tin at home and one at work.

I'm on my third tin, now, still liking it.

title: Great argan oil
text:
It's a big bottle, 4 oz is a lot of argan oil considering how little you need of it.

I use it for
cuticles
deep conditioning
a hair serum before flat ironing (just 2 drops!)
mixing with essential oils I use argan as the carrier oil
massage oil

For those who came here looking for it for your hair, as a deep conditioning you would want to apply it to dry hair and to the ends only, unless you have a dry scalp, then you can apply to your scalp. You can leave it in as long as you want, and wrap your hair in saran wrap for an even more intense conditioning. When you have a good idea of how much to use, you can do it on damp hair. You can mix with coconut oil if you want the benefits of both. Wash it out with a good lathering shampoo after.

If you want to use it as a leave in, I recommend just two drops applied to the ends and then the fly aways. I put the drops in my palm and rub my hands together and apply just 2 drops. Unless you have really thick hair you don't really need more. This will leave you with really soft, silky, shiny hair that is not greasy.

I got a coupon to try this product out for a huge discount in order to provide feedback and an honest review. I am more than happy with this argan oil, as i have tried others and some I was definitely not happy with.

title: Worth the purchase!
text:
I have a toddler, I need a no-slip option for the tub. I searched, for a good option that was also cost effective. I didn't want a mat - to me, they are too thick and get grimmey/slimey around the suction cups. This was a fun print that is also a good alternative. I had to buy 2 packs (I bought 1 turtle and 1 penguin pack) so there would be enough to fit my standard sized tub.

Pros: The colors are vibrant and don't quickly fade (I am writing this review almost 2 months after purchase/install... 2-3 showers are taken daily in the tub where these are located). These stuck easily and have adhered nicely - they have not moved or lifted (i put these in when the tub was clean and dry). My toddler likes that there are animals in the tub. The no-slip surface isn't too rough and it does prevent slips!

Cons: I just wish there were more in a package - I had to buy 2 packs which wasn't the worst thing because I was able to get a 2nd print. A variety pack would also have been nice with a few different animal prints instead of all one print but I still love this purchase!

title: Laura Mercier Night Nutrition a good value
text: My jar is almost empty and I can honestly evaluate it, according to my personal experience.  First of all, I love the smell....so light.  It reminds me of my mother's Pond's face cream of the 50's.  It goes on light and feels instantly moisturizing on your skin.  Doesn't soak in quickly.  Everyone seems to really love this cream according to all the reviews I saw on the internet. It is creamy and light and feels great when you first put it on.  Just one important thing the reviews don't tell you - after a short time,the cream will begin to "ball up" on the face if you wear it under makeup. Fine for going to bed but give it an hour so it doesn't come off on the pillow.  Nowhere have I seen anything about it balling up mentioned, so I am only giving you a heads up on the fact that it does this.  Otherwise, it does moisturize your skin very well and will last a long while during the day if you don't wear makeup over it.  When I am home, I usually apply after my shower and wear no makeup.  Works better that way for me.

title: Best. Lotion. Ever.
text: I love this lotion! I ordered the salve 2 years ago when I had contact dermatitis on my hand from using a very strong cleaning spray. Nothing helped the dermatitis until I tried the salve and it cleared it up in less than 24 hours! 2 months ago I had a bad case of cellulitis on my chest was put on 3 different types of VERY STRONG antibiotics-they didn't work! I thought of the Fay Farm salve and remembered they also had a lotion and ordered it. Within DAYS the cellulitis started to ckear up. I had even had a skin biopsy taken, 3 doctors were concerned it was cancer when they 3 antibiotics did nothing. This lotion is PURE GOLD... After moving to a northern state this summer my hands are so dry and cracked my fingertips were cracking open by my nails--so painful! I'm now slathering this lotion on my hands. And I also had a head cold a couple weeks ago--my nose was so red I started putting the lotion on my nose at night before I got in bed--and my nose didn't peel! My husband isn't crazy about the smell if the lotion but I LOVE it!  When I ordered the lotion I also ordered another tin of the salve--also amazing stuff!

title: This Mask Is Awesome
text: So I've tried A LOT of sheet masks and NONE of them worked for me. They either broke me out, or didn't secure on my face right, or they just didn't do anything for my face at all. This is the first sheet mask where I actually felt my face responding to it in a good way. It smelled just like citrus without it being too overpowering, nor was the tingly sensation, it told me that it was working! I also liked how this wasn't dripping with ampoule, it had the perfect amount to soak the face without it making a mess on your countertop or where the stuff would be rolling down your face and to your chest or creeping towards your eyes. So that in turn made wearing this more relaxing and not so irritating and awkward like most if not all the other sheet masks I tried. I almost didn't want to remove it, that's how much I enjoyed and loved it! I couldn't believe how baby soft smooth my skin was after using it. It wasn't a life-changer or game-changer for my hyperpigmentation, but it's unrealistic and next to impossible for any product to do that after only one use. My skin loved this though, I can tell that this is perfect for my skin type (combination/oily acne prone skin). I thought I'd swore off sheet masks. Granted, I'm still not blown away by sheet masks in general, this mask hasn't made me a fan of them, BUT...I'd totally buy this again. It was awesome.

title: Junk.  The nozzle has a spray tip that can come loose and end up lodged in your nose.
text:
I tolerated these poor performing devices because of the good price, but when I had part of the nozzle come loose and lodge in my nose, that was enough. It took a lot to blow it back out, was almost stuck in my nasal cavity. No nasal mister is worth that risk.

On top of that, these leak if they are not upright. Carry them in a bag or a pocket? They leak. They also don't last long enough to dispense the fluid in them - the nozzle literally wears out and becomes non-misting pump that barely works. Spend the extra 30 cents and get something that works.

title: Nice set that clears up counter space while keeping teeth healthy.
text:
I am a Sonicare user for a long time and have had three different models over the years.
The tooth brush here is pretty standard for Sonicare. 2 minute timer with 30 second interval alert.

Its a little fatter than most of their latest models but not at all a hindrance This means its a nickel metal hydryde battery vs the lithium ion in the newest versions.

The real news is in the flosser. I've used Waterpiks off and on over the years and always had good results. The downside was always the container that had to be stored on the counter top.

After using this for several weeks I can say that it is very handy and works well. The handle is fairly large and much bigger and heavier than a Waterpik handle which took a bit of getting used to. In general I would say its a bit of a draw between the two with the edge going to the Sonicare for the ability to clean it and store it quickly without taking up any counter space.

All in this kit is also less expensive than buying the pieces separately. However the trade off there is the bigger handle and weight of the tooth brush.

title: The 3 largest oval brushes are great. The small ones, not useful
text:
These brushes and handles seem sturdy. They arrived quickly and in good condition. I washed them with face wash, rinsed in cool water, and dried standing up in a coffee cup (because you SHOULD wash new makeup brushes.) They did not lose any bristles and dried overnight in like-new condition.

The second-largest brush was GREAT for applying IT CC Cream (liquid foundation). The bristles are dense and soft. I needed LESS foundation, and it applied easily and very smoothly offering even coverage. This one's a winner.

The largest brush applied Bare Minerals Mineral Veil quickly and easily. It was dense and soft. I'll use this again, too.

I tried one of the smaller, round brushes for eyeshadow. It didn't do a good job laying down pigment, and felt rough and uncomfortable.

I've seen demos of the third largest oval brush used to apply setting powder to the under eye area. This would probably work well.

The linear brush was not useful to apply powder shadow as liner.

title: Very Good For Some Purposes, Difficult For Others
text: I have about 5 different colors of this Mofajang Hair Color Wax Temporary Hairstyle Cream, and I purchased them before I got this gray sample to try. what I like about these products is that they add a temporary color to my already light grey hair- such as a pink or purple tinge or even a darker gray or darker blue gray...you get the picture. This easily adds a pastel color to my lighter hair with a smallish amount of product.  I could see that to change up dark hair or to get a strong/intense color tone, you'd need to pile this stuff on, and I think that's where this gets a bad rap. Yes, you can glob this on to higher opacity and change your dark colored hair to the color shown in the jar. BUT, you need a lot to do this, and you may not like the sticky, waxy result -it is wax, after all. If you are using a little bit (about a quarter sized blob) and adding this through your washed and wet hair and then blow dry, your hair will still move naturally and have the lighter tone of the product, provided your hair was fairly light to begin with-- just my two cents.

title: Wonderfully moisturizing
text:
Review for C'est Moi Vanilla Vibes Sugar Balm Body Scrub | Invigorating & Hydrating Exfoliant, Clinically Tested Non-Toxic Ingredients

This is my kind of sugar scrub. It cleans and exfoliates while it also hydrates my skin. When I get out of the tub or shower I don’t have to apply lotion to my body because the scrub left my skin completely moisturized.

The sugar in this product does the job of exfoliating and making the skin fresh and new. The oil in the product does the moisturizing, much better than just a lotion after because it really coats the skin.

There will be some residue left in the tub or shower that has to be rinsed with really hot water when done or it will be slippery for the next shower or bath.

Definitely a recommend for anyone that understands what this product is.

title: A great shampoo!
text: This shampoo and conditioner say it says it is for people with curly hair. Well I am an African-American natural haired woman and my hair is supremely curly. My hair is really thick and not many shampoos and conditioners work the way that I want them to. So I go through Raton. I tried this shampoo and a clean my hair very very well and it didn't strip it of the natural oils that are already present in my hair.  It smells really great as well. Then I condition my hair with the conditioner that came with it and it made my curls so soft and it gave them a little bit of shine. This did everything then I expected it to and wanted it to. So I was not disappointed in the results. I'm going to try this on my daughters hair as well because they somehow misplaced all of their hair supplies. Her hair is much different than mine because she wears dreadlocks so hopefully this'll work just great and her hair as It did in mine. title: Just eh
text:
I was diagnosed with Bells Palsy and this was recommended to me as I have been taping my eye shut for the past two months. There are definitely positives and negatives to it. Overall, I wish the string was more comfortable and that the foam was slightly sticky so that it would adhere to my face so it wouldn't move around as much.

Positives - overall it does work. I am able to function for a lot longer than I could with the drops alone. I had to add a drop of liquid in order to really get the 'humidity' in the patch to start to build up. Honestly, I'm going through a lot so crying is not abnormal right now so that happened on its own.

Negatives - The string is VERY uncomfortable. It really needs to be much thicker so that it doesn't cut into the skin. I wasn't able to sleep with this as the only protection for my eye as I move around a lot and because it doesn't stick at all I would have knocked it off easily.

title: Finally a natural deodorant that lasts!
text: I’ve tried a lot of natural deodorants over the years. I can’t seem to tolerate the formulas with baking soda even though they do seem to work a bit better. I had been using Schmidt’s sensitive skin for awhile, but found it just didn’t keep me from getting funky. So I started looking for alternatives and found this. I was intrigued by the usage of milk of magnesia and figured I’d give it a shot. To my surprise, this has worked amazingly! It lasts all day (and honestly, sometimes into a second day if I forget to put it on again!) you do need to apply to your pits and give it a few minutes to dry before you put clothes on, or else you’ll get a chalky residue. (It washes out though!) This is supposed to have lemon myrtle in it, but I can’t smell it. It’s pretty neutral smelling. I do wish it had a a stronger scent of some sort, but this isn’t that big of a drawback for me. It controls odor beautifully.

title: I love these nails, but...
text:
I bought this because I was wanting to try fiberglass without spending a ton on something I might hate. I definitely do not hate these nails! They are thin and natural looking, and still super strong. I will absolutely continue using fiberglass nails.

BUT... They are a bit of a pain to use, and some of that pain is actual, physical pain from getting fiberglass stuck in your skin. I'd advise using gloves, and will follow my own advice on that going forward. Fiberglass is actual wee little glass fibers which are nearly impossible to see and remove when you get a bit stuck in your skin and can be really irritating and painful. I ended up smearing my hands with tacky glue, letting it dry, and then peeling it off to get rid of the it. It worked pretty well, but yeah, gloves.

The gel in this set cured well, and as I said, my nails are very strong. I used Young Nails Protien Bond and the base coat, and so far no lifting whatsoever, when I usually would start seeing some.

The little LED light is cute, but I wouldn't ever use it for curing nails. I have a better light and I halved the recommending curing times since they're given for the tiny lamp.

There's a little tin of loose fibers, which I'm not sure how to use.

The set also comes with two completely useless pairs of tweezers, which I just tossed.

title: OMG! Immediate relief.
text: These gloves were better than I ever imagined. The moment I put my first hand in I felt relief. Once the second hand was in I felt like trumpets of glory where playing overhead. These are very tight and hard to get off but pure heaven when on. Coming from me is odd being an avowed atheist but I know what the phrase connotes. I slept so well not thinking or waking to pain. It was a bit of a struggle removing in the am but well worth it.  The socks feel great but I have very large feet. Size 11. That's why I bought the "men's gray".  These barely fit my feet and the right one kept coming off during the night because that foot is about 11 1/2.  I highly recommend for anyone with normal foot size for any reason. They feel GREAT.

My dogs love this type of brush but the bristles are kinda sharp. Just don’t be aggressive with it, and it’ll work great. I have another expensive brand brush similar to this, and I’d rather save money and get this anyway. Plus, I can put my kid to work brushing the dogs now because he can actually use this brush with his small hands. The other brush isn’t as ergonomic and is more difficult for me to use too.

title: BUT I didn't want to let this one go - it really is great - well-made and fits way more than I thought
text: I bought this in July when Amazon had a big one day sale. The product title led me to believe that I was getting two three piece units. My daughter in law loves hers, so I thought I would gt this for myself and the other for a gift. I was upset when one came, instead of two. I REALLY was impressed with the one, but wanted the value I thought I was buying. Apparently I am not the only on that interpreted it as two complete units. Amazon told me I could return the one unit for ta refund, BUT I didn't want to let this one go - it really is great - well-made and fits way more than I thought. I got in touch with MelodySusie, expressing my dismay, and they told me that I was not the first to complain with this problem (I must say - it took them a long time to change their description). They sent out the second unit to me NO PROBLEM! As much as I love Amazon's customer service, MelodieSusie was wiling to do what Amazon would not. I am SO PLEASED. This product is very high quality and even though I don't wear a lot of makeup, or have to rush everyday to gt out of the door - it saves me so much time.  I was keeping my makeup in a beautiful Longaberger basket, but had to dig constantly to find what I wanted. You will love it

title: Design is AWESOME, Sadly I think there is bacteria risk
text: Just start off with saying I did not purchase this product via Amazon I bought it at a Whole Foods near my home.  Also that I am thrilled with the design, carrying case, cleaning brush, and cap that come with the product. I do believe the design prevents back flow of mucus but I do not believe there is anyway to 100% guarantee that pathogens cannot be inhaled.  I stand here with a scratchy throat as exhibit A!  Sorry but this is not the first time I feel I directly and immediately contracted an infection through use of this type of aspirator.  First time was with the NoseFrida which is why I switched.  I thought the hose was getting old as I had had it for a year and decided to get a new frida.  When I saw the ecopiggy on the shelf I decided to chuck the filters and go with this far superior design/concept.  Well I feel think the back splash of what ever pathogens exist in my baby's mucus have found their way into my throat through inhalation.  I do not have a degree in science and I cannot deny that I may have already been infected and am just now showing symptoms but I just feel the device is suspect and have read many other similar comments. So just decided to put a public service announcement out and let people know so maybe some more research will happen to get us that 100% safe rate we want to keep using this wonderful concept!

text:
I researched all of the Norelco beard trimmers before deciding to buy on Amazon. I read all of the reviews and noted some of the negatives like noise and the fact that the shaver doesn't "vaccum" all of the whiskers. I must say I haven't seen much of these negatives. The trimmer works great and beats my old Braun which did not collect whiskers. I would say that 90% of the whiskers are collected in the compartment rather than on my bathroom counter. The noise in my opinion is to be expected given the cutting and vacuum action being performed. I especially like the carrying case and accessory trimmer that are included with this model. The only negative I have noted is that the trimmer settings are not real precise. If I want a real clean look I have to go all the way down to the lowest setting and my goatee needs trimming about every 3 days. For the guys who are able to keep their beards a little longer this is probably not much of an issue.

I highly recommend this shaver if you are wanting a clean, neat trim.

title: Great shave and great warranty
text:
In reading the comments I noticed that almost no one compared different shavers.
I have used a Norelco for years but I wanted something that was better and quicker to use on a two or three day beard. I have a Philips Norelco 4500. I bought the Wahl Smart Shave and the Braun 3040s.
After a two week trial I came up with the following observations.
On all three the blades float so they stay close to the face as you shave.
On the Norelco and the Wahl the head swivels too. It’s nice but I would not miss it if it were not there.
The Norelco is smoother and quieter than the other two. It is also the easiest to clean. It only takes one hand. Norelco recommends (and it is true) that saving in a circular motion works the best with their shaver.
The Norelco and the Wahl have Lithium batteries. The Braun has an NiMH battery. I like the Lithium.
I think the Wahl and the Braun shave closer than the Norelco but they are all close.
As for the trimmers, they all cut about the same. I would not buy a shaver without it. The Wahl is harder to manipulate. It has a nice metallic finish but that makes it hard to move up or down. It slips under your thumb.
The Wahl has the better battery and charge level indicator and a five year warranty. Wahl replacement head and blades are not on Amazon now. The Braun blades are easier to replace and the part is available on Amazon. Norelco blades are also easy to replace and available on Amazon.
I like all three shavers. For those with a light beard or with a medium beard and you shave every day I would recommend the Norelco. For those with a heavy or a three day beard I would recommend the Braun.

title: Stunningly Brilliant, Gorgous Wedding or Prom Hair Comb with Vintage Scroll Design from Mariell
text: When I think of wedding jewelry, I think of delicate, feminine jewelry that you wouldn’t necessarily wear on a day to day basis. I purchased this lovely Crystal Bridal Comb with an Elegant Scroll Design from my favorite online jeweler, Mariell. This bridal comb is stunning, and just perfect for updos or to catch a section of hair to accent. This beautiful, vintage looking hair comb measures 4 inches wide and is 2 ¼ inches high. It’s just the right size to make a statement without taking away from the beauty of the bride. This comb has top quality, European crystals set in a vintage scroll motif that offers an easy, classic, never-goes-out-of-style appearance. The comb also arrives in a lovely gift box, ready to give to someone special in your life. This would be so pretty for weddings, proms, formal events and special parties. I would not limit this to weddings. It’s just too pretty to wear only one time. Also, this gorgeous comb should last for years of use with proper care. It should be stored in a dust free location and it should not be worn during swimming or bathing. It can be wiped clean with a soft cloth and an alcohol pad, if necessary. If you do this, the brilliance and shine will come back every time and this will greatly increase the lifespan of this precious piece of jewelry. Like all jewelry from Mariell, this product comes with a risk-free, lifetime guarantee for replacement or money back. This is really great to know before you buy. It’s a risk free purchase. I do hope that this review helps to better inform your purchasing decision on this product. Thanks so much for reading. Disclaimer: I received this product at a Discount in exchange for my honest review.

title: Awesome remover!!!
text: My family loves this!!! It has made cleaning off the nail polishes so much better. No more tiny pieces of thin cotton sheets being wasted and found everywhere because children loves to play with the sheets. The clean ones, not the used ones. I can just pour out the remover when it's too colored and refill it with new remover. Keeping the same remover for too long gives it a chance to dye your fingers. Don't do it. There's a strong alcohol scent to it, but that's expected. The stronger the alcohol, the more likely it'll remove tough nail polishes. Oh, but it also messes up the fingers more too. Dry, cracked, white powder, and so on on the nails. Eeek! The only problem I can honestly say is that after removing the nail polishes too many times, the nail polish stays on the sponge. It's so hard to clean it! Maybe add extra sponges for the remover next time? I know that I can buy my own sponges and put it inside too, but it's going to be be hard having to find the perfect fit sponge. I still like this remover though. It's really nice and I'm extremely satisfied with it. I'd buy more in the future.

title: Works well
text:
This isn't bad and it works, I just wish that the design was a little different so that I could lay it on the counter more easily.

The good of this is that you can use it on wet hair and it does straighten. There's only one button on this, although it's surrounded by several lights that give off the impression that they should also be buttons, which is very slightly confusing at first. It's easy to change between temperatures and the unit heats up incredibly quickly, which is awesome.

The downside to this is that the design makes it more difficult to lay down on the counter - if you have a sink that is slightly raised then you can prop it up against that, but I do wish it had something like some of the curling irons have. It also comes with a small bag, but I'm slightly worried about putting the straightener in the bag if it's even slightly warm, as it's the type of material that could melt easily.

I'm not really familiar with straighteners in general, but this does seem like it's designed to be similar to some of the more name brand, expensive items out there. I'm not entirely sure how the price compares, though. Overall this isn't bad.

title: Regular Miracle Face Transformer vs. Correcting Coverage
text: The "correcting coverage" product is a little bit darker than the "light" Miracle Face Transformer I've been using (the normal type).  It is a little heavier than the regular product, and provides a little more coverage.  Both products cover my large pores and mellow my red undertones similarly, but the "correcting coverage" product covers dark spots better.  While the regular Miracle Face Transformer always blends perfectly into my fair skin (I usually wear the lightest foundation color in drugstore brands; NC15 in MAC) but can look a little bit orange on my cheeks when my face is dry.  It glides on smoothly and provides SPF.  I have semi-sensitive skin, and this product has not caused any irritation.

title: Not quite my grandfather's shaving brush
text:
My maternal grandfather passed away some 40 years ago. After my mother returned from her out-of-state trip to be with her mother and bury her father, she gave me a small box containing some of his personal belongings. Among them was his Ever Ready PBT300 shaving brush. I had no use for it at the time. As I unpacked after a recent move I rediscovered this item and decided to use it. It was really enjoyable, so after a few months I decided granddad's brush should be properly retired and I should get my own. Since they no longer manufacture Ever Ready's, I looked here at Amazon. This was the brush I decided upon. It's ok.

It is definitely NOT my grandfather's brush - quality-wise. Grand dad was a farmer, and not a gentleman farmer. So he would not have paid a lot for his. So I thought this one might be similar in quality. I was wrong. It's very stiff. It does not do a great job with the soap lather. It also arrived with a very strong, musky aroma in the bristles. This is probably what badgers smell like. But as I am a native of southern California and we don't need no stinkin' badgers here, I am not positive. This aroma was also transferred to my face as well, for the first month of use. Just prior to the musky animal aroma disappearing, I was frustrated enough with the smell on me all day to look for another brush. Since my grandfather's brush had no aroma I knew it was possible to have one that was aroma - free. But was it a matter of quality or simply a matter of time?

I purchased a $70 Vulfix brush, hand-made on the Isle of Man in the UK.

[...]

It is much more like granddad's in color, feel, and use. It lathers very nicely. It's very soft on the face. It holds a lot of water. There was a slight smell (nothing at all like the SimplyBeautiful smell)that was gone after the 2nd use. If you are thinking about going with a shaving brush (and I LOVE mine and will only go back to the can for short travel trips), my advice is to spend the money and get one that will last for a few decades (like the Vulfix) and avoid the "badgery" smell - although it did eventually go away. I haven't made the decision to also go with the straight razor. I figure I will give the EMTs in the area a break and stick with the safety razor.....

title: WATER LEAK WITHIN 2 MONTHS
text:

A few days ago, it started working intermittantly. I replaced the batteries. Still worked intermittantly. I replaced the batteries. It made a faint humming sound. I will contact the Philips Co. and let them know. I really love this toothbrush and hope they will correct the leak situation. When they do, I would definitely buy a new one.

title: UV LED Nail Lamp Dryer 54W Curing Nail Lamp Nail Light for Gel Polish
text:
Gel nails-they don't chip, break or fail in any way. For those of us who type regularly, we love nail polish that doesn't wear off at the tips in a few days. If you are a gel nail lover, this is a great kit to get.

This is my second gel nail kit. This kit has the light with a LCD screen, a timer and an infrared sensor. This also has a nail file with it, and I love the fact that this kit includes a pair of gloves. By the way, this type of light is the type of light used in tanning beds, and can be dangerous to your hands. It is important to use sunscreen, and to cut the tips of the fingers off the gloves to use with the light to decrease the exposure to your hands. The timer sets well and it takes (if you have help). Again, I noticed no issues with the light, it worked fine, and it was easy to use. I liked the accessories.

I think this is a reasonable price, and buying this kit plus some gel nail polish, with top and bottom coats and doing your nails is cheaper than any nail place. I highly recommend-you will probably get better results if you do your nails yourself.

Looks super natural and never cakey, lasts all day, does not settle into lines/pores, and most importantly, does not break me out or irritate my skin. My only complaint is that I wish it had slightly better coverage because I am lazy and don't like using concealer...it is buildable for sure, but I would still call it only medium coverage, definitely not full. But compared to everything else I have tried, I would still give it 5 stars.

title: I love it!!
text: I am in love!!! I am 33 and have extremely oily skin (as in blot the oil off my face 8-10 times a day) and it is also acne prone. I used the fullers earth 2 nights in a row before bed (I LOVE how tight my skin feels afterward) and before I put on my makeup I use the clean and clear oil control and the amount of oil on my face has drastically reduced. I know what you're thinking "it was the oil control lotion" I thought that too until I went a week without using the mask but continuing to use the oil control lotion and my skin is just as oily as before. I started using the mask again and the oil is gone. I use I scoop on a plastic spoon and stir in water slowly until it is about the consistency of pudding. I save the left overs in a sealed plastic container for later use. I must admit that I looked at a LOT of other companies (including the Aztec healing clay) but none of them could confirm that they were selling cosmetic grade fullers earth like this product. I have had NO bad reactions when using it, even my sister who is allergic to EVERYTHING cosmetic didn't even have a skin reaction to having it on her face. Despite the $15 price tag I would be hard pressed to switch to any other brand.

title: Awesome product
text:
It's been years since I used Baby Feet and now I'm back for another treatment. Those calluses build up again, it's inevitable. I want my feet to be beautiful again and I know how to do it. This is the stuff. Okay so one thing to remember. You really better not try to walk with the booties on. The gel inside is super slippery and it's hard to keep your balance. You want to plan to be in a place where you can just sit for the time, then take off the booties and wipe your feet, then maybe wipe them with a wet towel, then walk to the bathtub and rinse. Or something along those lines, you get what I mean. Don't try to walk with the booties on your feet, it is too slippery.

It takes a few days for the peeling to start. Then you have zombie feet for about a week, when all this dead skin is falling off. Wear socks. When that stage is over you will have the prettiest softest feet. It's great.

title: Helps My Sensitive Skin
text:
My skin is ridiculously sensitive, so finding products that won't set off some kind of irritation, breakouts, etc., is nearly impossible. I hadn't used a cica cream before, but the reviews were positive enough that I wanted to give it a try.

The texture is interesting - it's less a cream and more like a gel that's almost runny. It absorbs fairly quickly into the skin and doesn't leave behind any kind of greasy residue. It does help with redness and dry patches, and at this point, it doesn't seem to cause breakouts.

I have to say, though, that I was hoping for longer-lasting, even cumulative results, because I apply this at night and right after I rinse my face off the next morning, it's almost like I never used the product at all. Maybe it's a matter of me having to use this twice a day (at least), but given the high price point for what is, in fact, a pretty small tube of product, I feel like I would go through the cream much too quickly that way.

Still, it does help a bit and doesn't seem to cause any issues, so this is one of the very few products that I can see myself continuing to use long-term.

title: Great customer service!
text:
[[VIDEOID:64f33f3faedf2b4f07d181b2c211a1e9]] So I just got this and may update later.
First off, seller tried to send first class (which is under a pound), this was marked 4 lbs. I’m glad the post office didn’t hold it or penalize Me at least.
First impression, love the heart. Very surprised that so much quality went into that and then the interior was just so cheap. Stacked nozzles that don’t stay together, a base that isn’t secure, and not a snug fit: one cat outburst and this things caput! Inside is a small container but it lasted a few hours more than I expected, although with the one hole, you can’t tell that you’re even diffusing anything unless you use a whole bottle of oil. It’s just too little being dispersed which is probably why it lasts longer. I like the concept, even my kids said it was cool, but def needs better construction to stabilize and make max use of the product.

Update- I took the extenders off and just use the base and it disperses the smell much better. It also lasted about twelve hours which was surprising for such a small vessel. I’m still taking off a Star bc of the cheap base. For the heart quality, there needs to be something not only more aesthetically pleasing but safer.

Update -3 weeks later and it no longer works. We aren’t sure if it’s the base or the cord. We tried everything in our end w sev outlets and USB boxes so we know it’s not ours. Asking company to send a new cord. I really don’t want to return it but I bought it for use, not decoration..
I emailed the seller and they had us ship back the base-they refunded postage and we had a new base in less than a week. Very pleased with the quick turn around and help I received.

title: difference in one night
text:
I have such terrible skin, and at age 55 I need help of course! but I get such dry awful areas on my face. Washed my face, put some on last night, got up this morning, I could see a difference. So put some on again this morning, put on some primer and then my makeup. Normally by now, all the bad spots on my face are trying to peel up and look rough, so far all good, my face feels smooth and not rought. As far as pores (which is why I bought it) I will of course will let you know back...and I will, I hate when people say the will write back later...and don't!! But we shall see folks!!!

ok getting back, I actually have seen a difference in the pore size showing on my nose.....and I am happy about that! and in a short time too.

title: Makeup concealer
text:
This 3 pack of cream concealer is well, very concealing! Its thick and maybe that is why it is a challenge to get out of the twist tube every time. I felt as though I was twisting forever before anything came out and then when it finally did, it wouldn't stop! It was like an explosion of concealer and it unfortunately seems to do this with every use. With this concealer, you don't need much of it or it will begin to looked 'caked on". I would recommend getting a small container ready to put the extra in before beginning to use it.
Because of the 3 pack, you can blend them to match almost any skin tone which is a great feature. The clear containers also is a great feature too!

title: This is a lovely wig
text:
This wig is very beautiful and it doesn’t look very “wiggy”. The curls are more loose and natural looking and the photos show a more tight curl. I love the wig more in person. It is longer than what it looks like in the advertised photos. The discription states 22” and I’d say that is correct. Comes with a nude wig cap, no box but still nicely pacakaged and secure. I did have to sew in a clip in the back/base for better secure fit but I don’t mind doing that. Only minor issue is that the wig does have a strong plastic smell (like the smell of a new Barbie) right out of the packaging but again, I’m ok with that but this but it might be something that bothers you. It’s airing out right now and I hardly notice any smell 1 hour later. I don’t need to use any dry shampoo on this unit either.
AFTER CUSTOMIZING this unit, I have a few more notes and pictures:
I really love the shade “blorange” shade as it’s not too pink but it’s more blonde. Idk if I can see this particular shade working well with different skin tones but I’m neutral and I’m liking it. 3rd picture is the wig immediately after removing it from package and it actually was “wiggy” when seeing it in the sunlight. I previously said it wasn’t but I hadn’t seen it outdoors yet. After some dry shampoo, it’s fine! It’s a lot longer than 22” i measured 26” but it’s very full and luscious! The last pic is a close up of hairline after the lace was cut & I styled it. I have brushed this wig thoroughly a few times and I got almost NO shedding but I did have 1 tiny loose track come out upon removing it from package however, i think it was added to my bag? It’s in one piece and very tiny. All in all, I give it 10/10

title: A Surprising Find
text:
I got this today and tried it out right away. I only had a couple minutes and was happy to discover it blends quickly and easily. I’m fussy about makeup and don’t like the look of anything too obvious. After initial application I used my hands to gently wipe away excess and help it melt into the skin, it made a big difference. As an aside, it was very difficult to wash off my hands so I suspect it won’t transfer all over the place. It lives up to its name and imparts a lovely glow but doesn’t look oily or greasy. So far I’ve had it on for five hours and it still looks pretty good. I did spray my face with a bit of water and blotted with a tissue. That really smoothed the areas that we’re looking a bit dry. I need to swap to a heavier winter moisturizer and and had done no skin prep prior to application. Given that I can’t judge this too harshly.

As to the shade, it’s not prefect but close. I wear Cream in Hourglass Vanish foundation. I think that makes me close to NW15-20 in MAC. I feel like the cool tone version of 21 would work better, but this one is neutral enough I can make it work. A lot of times neutrals lean too warm but this one doesn’t seem too which means it’ll work for more people. I think depth wise it’s okay, but If you’re at all darker than me get the next shade up.

At under $13 this is pretty incredible. It doesn’t come with a refill, but given the price I’m not going to complain. Please note if you’re buying this only for the compact my AmorePacific cushion doesn’t not fit in this at all. So if you use anything shaped like that it won’t work. You could just swap the sponge with the actual product though. I will for sure be keeping this case, my kids love it too!

In the photo I’m also wearing Hourglass AL powder in Etherial Light, blush in Luminous Flush (also on eyes), and lip gloss in Cosmic Pink.

title: Does a great job preventing excess dust

This does a really great job of catching the dust from nail filings and sculpted products so my desk doesn’t look like a snowstorm when I’m done working. The fan is a little loud but makes sense since it’s working to suction in all the dust particles.  Definitely worth it!

title: Amazing little pins.  You can put your hair up in the blink of an eye!
text:
My first concern when I tried these spin pins was they were bound to get horribly tangled up in my waist length hair. I gave them a shot anyway.
To my amazement they not only went in quickly and easily, they held the weight of my hair up securely all day long. Ok, now to get them out, right? I slowly unscrewed each pin (they screw in and out). not once in over 2 years has one become stuck in my long and heavy hair.
I would recommend these to anyone. Probably the best and most serviceable hair "appliance" I have ever used. I bought the big box from Amazon. I cannot imagine being w/o them. I'd be lost in the summertime as this hair has to be put up to survive the heat. NOTHING I have tried for this purpose has ever served as well. Guess I ought to go to work for Goody's or something huh? I really am that impressed with this simple product.

title: A high-quality soap with great aroma, foaming and cleansing that I plan to use quite often
text:
Review of: TCM Men's Cleansing Activated Charcoal Bar Soap - For all skin types - 5oz (1 Pack)

In the handful of times that I’ve used the TCM Charcoal Bar Soap I’ve noticed a number of items that I’ve been really pleased to experience.

The first is the size of the bar; no wimpy sliver of soap here. The bar right around 3 inches in length, 1 ¾ inches wide and 1 ½ inches tall. A size big enough that, until I used the soap enough times to round off the edges, the size was almost too large to hold easily using just one hand.

A second, immediately noticeable, item was the smell. Not a sweet smell but more of a slight, dusky, flower-like aroma that, for me at least, was super nice. Perhaps, in it’s own way, as nice an aroma as I’ve found with any bar of soap.

The amazing amount of lather this bar gives off was another pleasant surprise, far more than I had expected from something that doesn’t fit into the ‘body-wash’ category. When washing my face, I only need to rub the bar in my hands a couple of times and then when the soap is rubbed onto my face the suds really start forming. The lather is impressive, especially compared to other ‘cleansing’ bars I’ve used before.

The charcoal, or maybe it’s some other ingredient, does seem to do a nice job of cleaning my face, especially after I’ve applied sun screen earlier in the day. Sun screen, in my experience, soaks into my skin really deeply and is almost like a magnet in attracting dirt, and many ‘regular’ soaps simply don’t seem to cut through the grim. The TCM soap, however, removes any embedded dirt and also does away with the slick feeling the sun screen leaves on my face. noticed that many cleaning soaps especially after washing my face.

On the other-side-of-the-coin, however, I’ve noticed that the TCM Charcoal Bar Soap leaves my skin drier than I expected; for me there was no real sense of having any moisturizing left on my face after washing. This dryness was apparent to me as, after washing, my face was almost too dry to be able to comfortably use my electric razor. Still, while that was a surprise to me I don’t consider the dryness to be a major concern compared to the cleaning benefits the soap gives.

All-in-all, the TCM Charcoal Bar is a high-quality soap that I plan to use quite often.

If this review was helpful, please click the Helpful button

title: Fairly inexpensive 100% remy hair, however, they don't really last more than two-weeks.
text:
I've been purchasing these extensions for the past year. I continued purchasing them after the first time because they ARE 100% remy hair and I've paid more than what these cost with other sellers claiming that their extensions were 100% remy hair when actually they appeared to be part Barbie hair and real hair. This is the reason I am giving this seller a 4 star. However, after a year of purchasing these, I am trying out a new seller (even lower price and 62% 5 star rating) because of the following reasons:

1. These extensions are very thin at the ends.
2. The ends require trimming as they appear to already be splitting when you receive them (so you have to make certain you order a length longer than you want to leave room for trimming).
3. The tape is really bad. However, this is not a reason I would never order from this seller again. I typically take the original tape off and replace them with better tape before I put them in.
4. No matter what type of shampoo/conditioner I use (sulfate free) or how often I wash my hair (twice a week), these extensions get dry/brittle/frizzy very quickly. And I do use Chi heat protectant prior to blow drying & flat ironing.
5. I consider myself in the mid-stages of DIY (I watch YouTube videos to find out how other DIY hair extension users prolong the use of the hair extensions, etc.), however, no matter what measures I take to keep them in my hair for more than two-weeks, I am still spending too much time and effort on the upkeep and replacing the tapes and putting them back in.
6. According to the description, these extensions are treated with a shed-free treatment to keep them from shedding, however, these extensions shed a lot. Obviously, if they are brittle/frizzy, they are going to break off.

I wanted to wait until I had purchased these extensions multiple times before writing my review so that I would be able to post a fair and honest review. Also, when I first started purchasing these, I was a newby at putting in and replacing hair extensions. And this review does not mean that I will never purchase these extensions from this seller again. They do have a good return policy that I could have used. Prior to purchasing from this seller, I had purchased hair extensions that were very expensive that I will never purchase from again. I do appreciate that this seller is not overpriced.

title: Great...BUT Beware of Size Issues
text:
EDIT - I wrote the review below and then I realized that each page has it's specific style AND varied SIZES. I didn't realize this at first. This fact alone will lead me to not buy them again. It's common to mess up on ONE brow in a pair. Its nice to be able to go to your page and just cut off a new one and not worry if it's the same size as the others. I only like the bigger (longer) brows, so I won't even want to use half the brows on each page. Major issue for me. I'll leave the tips below, because if you don't care about size differences, maybe this info will help you.

1- They are overall amazing!
2- They take some practice, but it's worth it.
3- When I mess up, I remove them with alcohol and toilet tissue. I wet it with alcohol and rub with dry toilet tissue. The dry helps rub the transfer off. It's not super pleasant, but it works.
5- They last for me for two full days.
6- As crazy as it sounds, I followed the advice of someone here and shaved my (small) brows after trying to apply over my natural brows. I was very freaked out about shaving my brows, but my brows sucked anyhow and it improved the look of these by far!
7- My advice is to try all or almost all of the varieties sent in the package. It can't hurt to try, right?! Remember you can always remove them if you really can't stand them. Some of the ones that looked very odd on paper, looked not bad on me! Some look better on "natural" days and some look better with make-up. I wear the ones I don't hate on days I'm just staying home and I save my favs for the days I go out.
8- The eyebrow print is on the front AND the back, so you can hold them up in the mirror to place correctly. Super helpful.
9- Again, overall these look very natural! To eliminate the shiny look they can have a little brush of power foundation works, but I have found that a little water splashed on my face after helps too.

title: Shooting Start Glitter Polish
text: I have had so much fun with this.  As other reviews have stated, you need a darker base coat to get the best out of this polish.  I had on silver and used this over it.  It was fun and festive.  Great for a party.  THEN I tried it over a black base coat and WOW it was so cute.  My nails looked just like the seller photos.  A few tips that worked for me:  I found that letting my base coat still be a little tacky, not completely dry, helped the sparkles grab better instead of sliding towards the tip.  I used the part of the wand before the brush to drop sparkles in blank spots.  Also, I swirled the brush around in the center of the bottle to get the best coat of sparkles on the brush before applying.  The finish was surprisingly smooth after I applied a top coat. There is only one drawback....it is a very thick polish and takes quite a while to dry even with quick dry top coat and drops.  Be prepared to spend some time.  It's not an every day polish for me but I love it when I take the time.  The polish lasted over a week and I'm very hard on my nails.

This wig is very long, reminds me of Elsa hair. The tone is very warm and yellow. You can style the wig some, but you can't pull it back in a ponytail because there's a thick yellow fabric band around the ears and sideburns area. You can style it in braids or other styles that aren't updo.
Despite being a nice, heavy weight, the hair shifts in the back, showing tracks.
Wig has a nice Lacey net inside with hooks on the sides to latch at the back, so it stays put.
Gets tangled very easily, and sheds a ton at first. Shedding gets better after a couple brushes. Shiny, improves with baby powder.
Would be great for photos or cosplay.
Good for the price.

title: Very affordable, great set
text: As a huge makeup enthusiast I have owned a ton of brushes in my time, and these brushes are right up there with my favorites! The wooden handles feel comfortable in my hands, the ferrules are nice and tight, and they're the perfect length to work with. I didn't notice much of that chemical smell you get with some brushes, so that was a big plus for me. They feel very high quality, and there's every single brush you need in one kit for less than I have paid for a single brush in the past. The bristles are soft, dense, and had minimal shedding, even when washed. They applied my makeup flawlessly, too, with bristles firm enough to achieve good coverage and soft enough not to irritate. The Brushegg is a great addition to the set, too, and is worth like $5-10 alone.  I held it in the palm of my hand and used a gentle shampoo, rubbed the brushes across the grooves in a circular motion, and my brushes washed very easily and thoroughly. Love the puff, too, especially the adorable packaging! I'm saving that one for a backup when my current one bites the dust. Very impressed overall with this set! The  I received the set at a discount for evaluation and review, but my opinions are 100% my own and were formed over the week I spent actually using all the tools to apply my makeup.

title: Excellent organic Hibiscus flower powder. Natural tea to manage blood pressure.
text:
I often make Hibiscus tea, using dried flowers. Then I consume the tea and the 'used' Hibiscus flower (to get all the antioxidants and organic compounds). This is the same Hibiscus flower that is dried and in powder form. So, using it to make beverages or in cooking is much easier.
I very much appreciate that the label displays two very important certifications/badges: USDA Organic and GMP (Good Manufacturing Practices). These two labels demonstrate the attention and commitment to the purity and integrity of the ingredients and processing. These two certifications check off critical boxes for me.
I added this powder to a smoothie, turing it a deep pink, which is a trademark of Hibiscus flower. I like the flavor of Hibiscus, perhaps due to drinking it somewhat regularly. When used in a smoothie, i found the other ingredients dominated the flavor, which is fine. I'm still getting the health benefits of the Hibiscus.
I am amazed that it can be used for a face mask, skin care and hair treatment. Personally, I'll take advantage of this powdered form for adding to smoothies/drinks and into cooking recipes. It acts an excellent organic, natural red coloring for baked goodies.
Overall, I am very satisfied with this product. It is exactly as described and shown in the product details. Accordingly, it merits a 5 star rating, with a very high level recommendation.

title: Small encapsulated eyeshadow sticks. Very cute, functional. Good value.
text:
An interesting delivery system for eyeshadow. They look like giant pill capsules, or midget lipstick shapes. Twelve different colors, shades complete this set, each delivering a rich, luxurious shimmering sheen. Each eyeshadow appears to be composed of quality materials/ingredients. The sizes allow them to be easily kept in a handbag or small clutch. In fact, that is the main feature of this product, the size.
In my opinion, these make great liners or to add accent. As a eyeshadow stick/pencil, these serve very well. Thanks to the variety of colors, in popular shades, they should be applicable to most users.
When I saw these, I felt they would be an excellent addition to a gift, swag bag (guest bag or gifts for bridal party). They are visually attractive, with a quality eyeshadow within,
Attached are photos to show real world images of the twelve pieces, with a ruler for size reference.
The significant other saw these and loved the mini format. She examined the colors and said all of them are nice, worthwhile. She dabbed a sample on her arm and used a finger to spread it. She said the consistency and shimmer are excellent. At the current price of $13, she felt it was a good deal: "Not bad, just a bit over a dollar each. it's well worth it." So, clearly, she like the form factor and the quality of the makeup (which I think is the priority).
Based on the initial impressions, the apparent quality of the eye shadow makeup, the cuteness factor and the good value, this product earns a solid 4.5 star rating, with a high level recommendation.

title: Reasonable value, Works well on first use
text:
I love that this is double sided and the fact that I can hold it in my hands comfortably. It has the right coarseness that can smoothen calluses and hardened skin on mostly by the big toes and the heel. It can also be used in other parts of the body where needed but take care not to scrub hard as it can scratch really well. Having 4 in a pack is a great perk so I can put one in each bathroom for use.

Questions: The questions will take time before I can have answers which means I will be back for an update: a. How long does each one last if using every other day?
b. Does this shred when in use that can possibly clog drains?
c. Can you put this in the microwave to disinfect?
d. Do both sides get smoother over time so you know when to change it?
e. Will these two blocks separate after a few uses?

I used to have a simple rough oval rock that I used as a pumice for a long time but then my kid took it and threw it in the lake thinking it was just a rock that has no use sitting in the bathroom. I have not found a good replacement since then.

title: Value for the price and a great hair cut set!
text:
I got AUGNORYE Hair Cutting Kit for home usage since it is much harder to go to a hair salon right now. I am not a professional and this is the first professional kit that I am using. This is a complete set and offers everything you need for home use and maybe even for hair salons. There are a few different combs, barber capes, clips, scissors, cleaning brushes, cloth and leather bag to keep everything organized.

Scissors: The blades are sharp and seem to be high quality and not very long to be hard to control for beginners. The handles are comfortable to use, and they are very good budget scissors.

Combs: There are different combs, both for cutting and brushing. The handles are again comfortable enough for more than personal usage. The combs don’t seem to be durable enough and you have to be careful about this.

Leather bag: There is a nice and high-quality leather bag included in the set and most if not all of the scissors and combs can easily fit in it. The zipper for the leather bag may not last a long time as I even had problems opening it the first time.

The rest of the set is as shown in the picture. Overall, apart from the zipper of the leather bag, I don’t see any other problems to it. I have included some pictures to help see what to expect.

I would recommend this kit to anyone and it will come pretty handy at home, especially during this pandemic haha

text:
The order comes in a jar of 100 ml in size. It's in a dark glass bottle. It's a cleansing oil to remove make-up. I use the cleansing oil to remove waterproof make-up like the eyeline or mascara that would otherwise need a lot of rubbing around the sensitve eye area with a regular cleanser. After the hard make-up is removed, I use the regular facial cleanser to wash my face.

The bottle has a pump that dispenses the oil. The cleansing oil is clear and has a nice scent to it from the cherry essential oil. I love that the product is all vegan and organic and USDA certified.

title: great tool for uneven eyebrows
text:
when i first saw these i didn't have much faith. i have bought something like this before that was a waste of money, i hated it so much i got mad -- even though i only paid less than 5 dollrs.

this is pretty cool, depending on your preferred shape, you can choose from the stencils they have and load it up to the holder. the stencils are not super stiff, they have some give so you can push them hard against your forehead.

this helped me a lot. i have very uneven eyebrows, they take me almost 30 minutes to do just trying to make them look like they are on the same level, one is at the basement and the other one is on the 3rd floor.

i don't use this to stencil my whole entire eyebrows, i use this to guide the top and the beginning of my eyebrows because that is where my struggle is and i freestyle the rest. and it has helped me alot. although it's not perfect, there could be improvements, it is still very useful.

it comes with a razor even so you can shape your brows.

the stencils were a little confusing at first, but to help you: I use E1 and E2. they are alphabetical and the pair should match in the letters but would be 1 & 2.

the elastic that came with it, supposedly to hold the stencil in place just broke right away, did not even start using it yet, but i don't think it's necessary.

hope this helps you.

title: Great product, soothing yet effective. Will be purchasing again.
text:
I love Sublime products. So naturally, when I saw this item, I HAD to have it. After a long, hot summer, my face really needed a little TLC - and this was the perfect solution.

I was very excited when the Amazon package arrived at my door step. In the box was a charming little cloth satchel and in it was the Polish.

The Polish smells wonderful. It is subtle but fresh and not overpowering - I am sensitive to smells and cannot stand strong perfumes. Sublime really nailed the scent.

The texture is lightly grainy, in a good way. I have used face Polish in the past where the texture was too fine and I felt like I had to really scrub to get any exfoliation... It was not the case here. The texture was spot on. It wasn't harsh at all, and my skin is quite sensitive.

The instructions are pretty standard.. Wet face, massage in circular motion, let sit for a couple of minutes, massage briefly and then wash off.

The results, however, were surprising. It left my skin incredibly soft and silky, after just one use. After several uses, my skin felt like it had completely recovered from a summer in the sun.

Looking at the ingredient list was also very reassuring.. The first ingredient listed is aloe.. No wonder it is so soothing.

Overall, I am really happy with this product. The best part was that when my husband got home he actually noticed a difference (without me mentioning anything).

I purchased this product at a reduced price for testing and review purposes.

title: Opinions may differ but I've searched In earnest, tried It all, and I've found *THIS IS THE BEST*
text:
I'm pretty particular, got a pretty good eye for discerninbg fine detail, worked in production for Universal Studios where where cosmetic detail is priority, , and for my aging beard, I've tried every product I can find. It's been a little over 2 years since I tried the Grizzly product and have not looked for or tried anything since. It's settled in my mind that you'll get the most realistic, undetectable, natural looking color enhancing of your beard. I mix about 1/3 Dark Brown with 2/3 Black. I do leave it on much longer than recommended sometimes 2-3 hours.

I also do it before I go to sleep to avoid down time waiting. IT DOES LOOK FUNNY WHEN YOU FIRST RINSE..."but"....it slowly changes to a natural look so you may want to DO IT AT NIGHT BEFORE BED or at least 6-8 hours before you venture out. I've gotten both green and purple tint upon rinsing but again, *this is part of the process* and the exposure to air and time slowly oxidizes the pigment and it will look amazing in several hours. Don't be afraid to mix shades to nail exactly what you want. I've used it with 3-4 inches beard length but lately keep it the "unshaven" stubble look with 1/8" to 1/4" length. As far as cost goes, I buy two shades, I apply twice a week, and from those two bags I get a full year. My last purchase was Oct. '17 and I'm just coming back to re-order. The previous year my beard was longer, maybe 3", and I re-ordered twice in a 12 month period. ..so it's now costing me around $2.50 per month to keep my beard looking much younger and natural looking.

My beard has much more gray than my hair, I'd say about 90% is white hairs. It took 2 or 3 applications in the first week or two for it to fully "take" , then it's just maintenance. I find the second and third days the best as it begins to fade just a little.... so the blend of just a bit of your natural gray with the treated looks impossible to detect any unnatural coloring. I find day four fading a little more than I want so hit again on the fourth night. I can start at 9pm, have the colors blended in a bowl, mixed with hot water (microwave), and applied on my beard by 9:05. I'm retired now so sometimes I'll watch movies and leave it on until 4am... but I could rinse at go to bed by 10:30 and still wake up with the best, most natural looking color enhancement out there.

The BOTTOM LINE:

1. If you just use the basic shades Grizzly should look better than anything you've tried before but don't be afraid to experiment by mixing colors if you want to nail your natural shade. Even if you miss it will still look presentable and natural because many have hair/beard color differences.

2. Don't panic, freak out, or get discouraged when you first rinse. The oxidation that will take place from exposure to air is part of the process that will give it the most natural appearance. The browns will have a bit of a green tint, the black will be purple. THIS CHANGES and transitions into a natural shade over the course of a few hours so it's best to do it before you go to bed. I've also found you can't leave it "too long". I've actually fallen asleep for the night with the stuff on...it hardens as it dries but softens with water then rinses right off. i find much better results when I leave on longer than instructed. I try to go at least 90 minutes and much longer if time allows. You forget it's on but don't leave the house. I usually keep mine on until it dries and hardens before washing off.

Henna is also a plant leaf so you'll smell like spinach until you rinse it off. Pretty weird at first but I no longer even notice the smell.

3. If there are negative reviews or you try and don't get what you want, it's only because you didn't use the patience to allow it to work. With a few tries I was able to come up with exactly what I wanted. If you'll give it a chance, (it's a quick, simple, 5 minute process to mix and apply but does take an hour to "take" before you rinse, then few hours afterward to transition) use a little patience, THIS IS THE BEST product you'll find and you should be able to get exactly what you want, sharpen your appearance significantly ,with a completely natural, undetectable enhancement to your appearance. 5 STARS !!

title: Short
text:
These are strong hair pins. Straight pins like these are the only thing that will hold up my waist-length, thick, coarse, curly hair. Bobby pins and open pins, along with pretty much any others that you find in a drugstore snap in half in my hair. These do not even bend. I could not be more happy with the hold. The ends look sharp and kind of dangerous, but really slide right into your hair. You would have to be pushing with great force to stab your scalp.

The only complaint I have is that these measure 2" rather than 2 1/2" as the description claims. I ordered these and the 3" pins from the same company at the same time, and they are both 1/2" short of their listed size. I measured them with a standard ruler, so I have no idea with what the company is measuring. It's not a huge problem at all, I just wanted to give a head's up.

The black coating does chip off a bit, but it's not even really noticeable, since the majority of the prong is covered by your hair. They will bend a little (from side-to-side and not in a scrunchy fashion) if you're really trying to cram them in, but they go right back in place.
