She would separate one to go with her outfit, which I found helpful in the process of doing her hair in the mornings. LOL. Another note I've noticed personally is that with other head ties, they can only withstand so much stretchy, the material to this product will allow you to stretch endlessly almost, so I'm happy to know this bunch will last a long while!! PLUS, PLUS in my book!! I wasn't too happy with the overall packaging, they didn't come neatly packaged, but I ripped the package open anyways so maybe it doesn't matter as much! Overall, I'm satisfied with my purchase!

title: The product works amazing!!
text:
First I want to say the three stars is for the product itself, which works great. Taking two stars off is for packaging, shipment, and customer service. So I ran out of nail polish remover not that long ago and have been looking for a better way to remove the nail polish with out all the chemicals. To my surprise I found this and was excited to try a all natural nail polish remover. Made with all plant based ingredients which is a huge plus for me. I hate the way traditional nail polish remover smells and I hate using that stuff for my daughters nails. Now I feel comfortable using this with my daughter so she does not have to breath in those harsh fumes. I did not have any nail polish on at first so I put some on and let it dry. Once it was dry I put one to two drops on each nail then waited about 2 to 3 minutes. It wiped right off on all the nails except one small spot that came off with one more drop.

When this bottle arrived it was leaking all over the box. The seal was broken and the plastic wrapped around the lid was torn. So I had very little left in the bottle. I contacted the seller to let them know and to see about getting a replacement bottle. I took some time to get a response but they did respond. After the second email they sent a code for a replacement. That code did not work so I reached out to them again. They said it is on amazon and that the code has worked for others. I tried multiple times and the code did not work. So even if it is on amazon to supply correct codes, the seller needs to do their part in making the experience pleseant with the customer and this was not that.

Still pleased with the product itself though.

I received this free or reduced price for product testing and review. Thank you and I hope you find this review helpful. I am under no obligation to provide a positive review and receive no incentives or rewards for doing so. My reviews are completely honest and are my personal experiences with the product. This disclosure is in accordance with the Federal Trade Commission Guidelines on Testimony and Advertising.

title: So good!
text: These reusable cotton rounds are awesome. I originally bought them to use with toner, but they are entirely too absorbent for that. I would be using 2 or 3 times the amount of toner. Instead, I use these to wipe my facial cleansers off of my face. I can use a fresh one each time without worrying about contamination or using a wash cloth. I hung the mini laundry bag up and throw them in when they’re used and the bag allows them to dry. When I do laundry, I tie the bag up like I’m tying shoes and throw them in the washer and dryer. They come out of the dryer clean, soft, flat, and (weirdly) stacked together and ready to go.

title: Not for Brown Skin. Not for Sensitive Skin.
text:
This product is not made for people with light brown to dark skin tones.

I bought this product mainly for my dark circles. It says the peach is for darker skin, and the pink for lighter skin, but they both look more or less the same. When I used the peach under the eye and on the eyelid, it made the dark circles even more obvious by leaving a cakey, whitish residue! My dark circles aren't even that bad! Usually, all I need is a tiny bit of concealer.

The colors need to be a little more differentiated.

I also don't recommend this for people with sensitive skin, since it dehydrates the skin, and also burns a bit!

title: Label stitched on bag read..."Wind Bowls" instead of "Wind Blows"!  That says it all.
text: This was a complete joke.  The second I pulled it out of the box, before I even removed it from the clear wrapping, I saw an obvious testament to its poor quality!  It features a prominently displayed label stitched to the front of it.  Instead of it reading..."Wind blows...River Flows", it said..."Wind Bowls...River Flows"!  Now maybe the wind is bowling during a thunderstorm...who knows?!  But I found this to be such a stupid thing to ship with it being so obvious.  I ordered it through PRIME, so it didn't ship to my house directly from China.  The material in itself was of cheap quality, and the one I received did not match the colors in the picture.  The part that should have been gray was definitely brown instead.  I drove this total waste of a purchase to the UPS store to ship it back since I paid over $12 for it.

title: Average quality, but quite convenient
text:
There isn’t much to say about a folding brush — it’s a brush and it folds. The plastic body is average quality; the hinge operates very smoothly; and the bristles are supposedly boar bristle, but you really just feel the nylon pins. The bristle area is quite small (about 3/4” x 3”), so this is really best suited for small, quick, on-the-go touch-ups. It folds quite compactly, so it’s easy to fit into a jacket pocket, computer case, purse, etc.

When I ordered it, the price was $4.00 ($7.99 minus a 50% coupon), but I see the price is now $5.99. For $4, I’d say this was a bargain; for $6, it’s just reasonably priced, assuming you have the need for a folding brush.

4 stars for a solid, but not particularly outstanding, product.

title: light hold, good gel to keep the frizz away
text:
The Natural Strong Hold Hair Styling Gel, the formula provides a light hold to all hair types without leaving a sticky finish. Directions tell you to put a dab of Hair Gel onto fingertips and rub hands together to coat evenly and rub into clean hair, starting at hairline, working to back of scalp. Style as desired. Now I'm not sure how Natural Strong Hold provides a light hold, but that seems like tricky name play. But it does what I need it to do. My daughters have very curly hair. On humid days they need to add a little gel to help keep the frizz away. Of course this had to have a screw on top so they dropped it right away. Well, the gel is clear, it comes out of carpet easier than expected and doesn't stain clothes. It also dries clear. I am not 100% happy with the hair gel being in a jar. Too many accidents happened.

I purchased the Hair Gel at a reduced price without the expectation of me leaving this review. I'm letting you know to save your money until they change the jar to a pump style dispenser.

title: Great diapers
text: I love the cloth-like feel of these and everything else about them, but wish they were not so bulky, wide in the crotch and had better design for blowouts, although this has not really been a big problem. (With us this could have been sizing issue...maybe babies are huge in Denmark!) My baby began wearing these at around 12 pounds. It is true that they are rather big on some babies. The Newborn size in Bambo is also big - we had to wait two months (11 pounds) to put them on our little boy. For all the new moms out there I would recommend getting small packs of few different brands of diapers to see which will work for their child. I tried 7th Generation and 365 too - those were way too thin and needed more height on the back for blowouts (they both allow for spectacular blowouts, I have to say!). Bambos have helped to control diaper rash and have very good absorbency. Honest diapers were good, but their newborn size had a mesh layer inside that kept sticking to the baby's skin and also allowed several moisture absorbing beads to stick to his skin when the diaper was very wet. I have read that it's not supposed to be an issue. Bambo Nature are good, give them a try.

title: Needs tightening before use, but then is fine.  Shipped with very low tension.  Firm screwdriver required.
text:
Needs tightening before use, but then is fine. Shipped with very low tension. Firm screwdriver required.

These are the most chic looking scissors in existence, with the hex-look multi-rainbow and openings.

Note, there is a screw on each side, different sizes, and it takes a fair bit of force to tune the tension. Not a thumbscrew or anything.

But, once tightened once, they don't come looser, and they cut great - using for thin gauze, which requires razor cut, and works fine.

I think I'll get a second pair for my daughter.

title: What they say is true -- this stuff works!
text:
I've been using this product for about 17 days now. To be honest, I haven't noticed too much of a difference. But then again, I don't really pay much attention to my eyelashes. I just decided to try this stuff for fun. So, today at lunch, my boyfriend of 10 years suddenly looked at me and said, "Are you wearing false eyelashes? They really look long! I've never seen them that long before. They look great!" Of course, I sat there with my mouth open, totally stunned. I thought that it must be a coincidence . . . maybe I put on more mascara than usual, or maybe he just happened to notice my eyelashes for the first time, etc. Then I thought that he's never said one thing about my eyelashes in the 10 years we've been together. Now that's either a really spooky coincidence or maybe, just maybe, this stuff actually works. I still think it's too early to tell and I continue to be skeptical at this point, but I thought I would at least put it out there for those who are considering this product. I'm not yet giving it my full endorsement because the verdict is still out, but I was just flabbergasted and stunned that I received such a comment after using this product for a little under 3 weeks. Is that crazy or what?!

UPDATE

This stuff definitely works. My eyelashes are so long that it's unbelievable. I was recently in a Vegas casino and the blackjack dealer at our table suddenly asked me, "Are those your real eyelashes?" I am so pleased with the results. However, I don't recommend using this on your lower lashes (unless you really want them to be just as long as your upper lashes. I tried this and they were getting way too long to look natural). I think this is a great alternative to purchasing an expensive brand name product that requires a prescription. Two months later, I'm still on my first tube (applying it one time per day) and I believe this tube will probably last me another two months. I've never experienced any of the irritation or redness that others have, but I did notice that my eyes were a little itchy the following morning. I do recommend this product and I'm so excited to continue using it and seeing the results. FYI -- a cheaper alternative that works just as well is Rapid Lash. I've since switched to Rapid Lash because I can get about three tubes of that product for the price of one tube of Renew Lash.

title: THIS is the BEST one out there!! Order this shampoo, you will NOT be disappointed!!!!!!
text:
Hi everyone, I just need to let you know, that THIS is absolutely THE BEST purple shampoo I have EVER used! And that’s saying something- since I have been a bleach blonde for about 13 years now, and have tried dozens and dozens of these, I’ve never had one work so great, and be so powerful, and do what it’s supposed to do, and yet be so gentle on my ends.. I’ve used purple shampoos/toners that have absolutely ruined my dry bleached ends, seemingly “chewed” right through them, and left them looking and feeling so terrible, they aren’t fixable, the only thing you can do is cut them off.. NOT THIS shampoo!! My ends are still healthy and smooth, and feel like they’ve never been bleached! I couldn’t have asked for a better purple shampoo!! The only reason for the 4 stars on the scent is because - it isn’t MY favorite, BUT it’s better than most, and to be fair, it’s really not bad, just not great! I do have a picky schnozz as well, so you be the judge!
Overall, this shampoo is so amazing, I’m getting ready to reorder, because my bottle is almost empty, and I want more.. Never had so many great compliments on my hair either!!!! Also have never referred so many people to a product like I have this one!!! AMAZING!!

title: Nice Little Rubber Bands - and Lots of Them!
text:
My zipped bag containing four smaller zipped bags of 250 each of black rubber bands arrived, and I set about trying them on my own hair. The bands are smaller than I expected and actually measured a little less than an 1" each. They do, however, stretch quite a bit. They do not feel like the usual rubber bands in that they are smooth and will not catch on your hair. Using one on my own mid-length hair, however, I did end up pulling a couple of strands out as I removed the band. I believe I may have placed too much hair into the band to start with. It could also be that a child might be better suited to wearing these than I am. My hair is a bit thick and long, or at least that is my opinion. These bands are not weak and should last well beyond one wearing. Therefore, there are lots of them for a small price. The bags, too, are cute and have a picture of a small chick on each.

I recommend this product without hesitation and think they are well priced for the amount of rubber bands you will receive.

title: Absolutely yucky on my skin!
text: I wish I had bought this on Amazon so I could return it! I use Cerave moisturiser as well as the facial moisturiser with spf 30 in it. I love those products.  However, I needed a higher spf protection sunscreen so I bought this thinking it would be similar to the other Cerave product I mentioned earlier and not likely to irritate my sensitive skin. This product was difficult to spread, sat on top of my skin, leaving a white, pasty, almost sticky coating. It's gross! It got all over my clothes too, which hopefully will wash out. It seems to have provided adequate sun protection (which I understand is the goal here) and has not otherwise irritated my skin, but that texture/coating is just unacceptable to me. I thought perhaps I had used too much product, but had the same problem with a white coating when applying a smaller amount. I'm going back to a different brand of sunscreen I used before.

title: My Chinese neighbor gave me this mask...
text: My Chinese neighbor is more aware of international products than I am. She gave me one of these masks. Told me to store it in the fridge until ready for use. I have my own skin regimen so I didn't rush to use this. One week, I got so busy that I slacked on my skin care. My face felt rough and dry. I thought, "well might as well try this mask, but it probably won't be able to help this rough dry skin situation." I left the mask on for 20 mins. My skin is sooooo soft. I am astonished at how well this mask worked! I ordered 20 more online immediately!  I have so many skin care products (VERY EXPENSIVE - - La Mer, Laura Mercier, Charlotte Tilbury) and face masks as well... none of them are THIS EFFECTIVE. So simple. Just 20 mins and you will have the smoothest skin of your life. I am very grateful to my neighbor! Also I would never think to allow snail residue on my face. Apparently it works wonders though, so I'm a convert.

title: Nice chair
text:
Very nice chair. This one competes nicely with the one at Cosco that my buddy bought for $1800. I’m 6’2” 280lbs and it fits me comfortably. And you can sit in it as a regular chair when you have it off. Now instructions how to operate are definitely not clear so you have to fiddle around with it to figure out. And instructions how to put together are not clear either. I’m a carpenter with mechanical skills and you need moderate critical thinking skills to put together. The delivery company delivered it where I wanted it but you have to put sides on and plug in pads. Kind of hard to push air tubes into fittings too.
When you have it together and you get it working it messages your back nicely, sometimes it’s alittle rough on lower back but all in all great on back. Feet massage is ok too. Now the arm and calf air bags can get out of control so sometimes I’m not up for the torture and I leave them out and with no clear instructions how to maneuver the hand held remote, I just leave my arms and legs out, But like I said sometimes i can take it. The air bags adjust to your arms and legs but they are strong! But with that said I’m glad I bought it very nice great message, glad I bought.

The hair was not scratchy on my back and looked very realistic. I would 100% but this wig again . Shipping was a little slow .

title: Lots and lots of color
text:
The words lip gloss and lip stick are both used in the descriptor for this product, but the actual tubes all say gloss and the applicator is what I would expect in a lip gloss. Some of the colors are strong enough to almost be considered lipstick.
The lip gloss comes in a small black box and there are 24 colors including browns, oranges, reds, pinks and even a few violets. None of the tubes have color names on them, just numbers. Also included is a 7x4in drawstring bag. It's made from very soft, velvety material and it is light pink with the company name "Chialstar" in a darker pink.
The lip gloss goes on easily and smoothly and lasts for quite awhile; I usually only have to reapply once or twice at most. The only thing I dislike about these glosses is the slightly glue like texture while the color is drying and still tacky. If I put my lips together, they feel glued together when I try to open my mouth, but that goes away as soon as it is completely dry.
I received this product at a discount in exchange for my honest review.

title: Might be too harsh for sensitive skin
text: I really wanted this deodorant to work for me. It was the perfect sweet and earthy scent. I wore the deodorant for a day and I must say, it does work. I was fresh my entire 12 hour shift. However, when I took a shower that night I noticed that a spot under my arm was very sensitive to touch. It was like a burning sensation. I thought maybe I had scrubbed too hard so I didn't apply the deodorant before I went to bed. The next morning I applied it and both of my arm pits were literally on FIRE! The pain was a 6/10 so I could not apply any kind of deodorant for several hours. I'm sure I had an allergic reaction, but I'm not sure if it was the fragrance or just the overall ingredients used in the deodorant. So I'm thinking it is probably just too harsh for sensitive skin.

I had ordered smaller bottle type jugs in the past and have gone through them on my first or second batch, having to re-order them frequently and also spending a lot of money on them. With this one I was able to scoop about 2 cups worth of one of the bottles and I still have plenty left over not only in the bottle I’ve used from but I still have the other bottle left! I definitely recommend purchasing this if you make your own lotions, etc (for personal use) because you will have a lot left over to make more batches and you won’t end up spending a ton of money on it!

title: Eye patches for aging eyes
text:
Packaging
Eye pads shipped in a clear plastic wrap. Opening the bag you find the individually wrapped patches. They are pairs of pads in a gold foil like package.

Product
On the back of the packaging is a couple detailed features of the eye patches that explain the benefit of absorption and effectiveness of this product. The rest of the details on the packaging is not in English unfortunately. Opening the individually wrapped foil type envelope you pull out a pair of white crescent shaped under eye pads. They are shaped for placement under each eye with each being unique to your left and right eye. They adhere in place well, and yet the peel off easy with no discomfort. They are soft to the touch and cool and soothing on your skin.

Conclusion
My wife was looking for a new eye patch for aging eyes. These patches diminish the dark circles in the eye area. Helps shrink puffy bags and any swelling in general. Noticed a brightening of the skin tone under the eye (lighter and brighter). Recommend these eye pads. I will order these again. Full disclosure, I love to shop on amazon and I always look at customer reviews and the number of stars for the review total average before purchasing a product. Since I rely heavily on others reviews, I am always honest in my reviews, and try to always leave feedback to help others when making a purchase. The product has been fully tested and inspected and my review is based on experience with this product. If you found this review to be helpful please click “yes” at the bottom of my review and if you have any additional questions always feel free to ask.

title: Buyer Beware
text:
Bowl is not adjustable, cheap construction
Description says "Adjustable Height that Allow Users to Angle Bowl Properly for Most Comfort" but that's not true. There is no mechanism for adjusting the angle of the shampoo bowl. You might loosen the screws that hold the bar across the back to give it more "swing" but my worry is that it might flip over and dump water in the face. The lever for adjusting the height is not as well made as the one on my fan and it doesn't have to support a human head. The hose is very short.

Since this is not Amazon, I got stuck with shipping both ways and probably a restocking fee. There are much better option available and better vendors.

title: My son had a skin reaction
text: [[VIDEOID:3f0dc5cdbaae275396f789b093c7dba2]] I am afraid I can only give 3 stars to these. Although they are beautifully packaged, big, brightly colored, and strongly scented, and my son loved the little pokemon figures (he got Charzaar, Pikachu, Zubat and Cherubi), he unfortunately had a skin reaction to the green one. He said the water was hurting and burning, so we got him out and his skin was red in patches that had been submerged in the water. Since he had no reaction to the others (in fact he used the blue one and the red one on the same night in one tub of water) I must assume there was some irritanting ingredient in the green one. He does not have especially sensitive skin. Sorry, but won't be purchasing these cute bombs again.

title: Bought for use with UV Resin
text:
I didn't buy this for nails, but for curing UV Resin. And it works like a charm. I'm using resin from the Sophie & Toffee brand at the moment, and I leave it in for roughly 10min each cure. It's given me consistent hard cures each time.

The lamp is really lightweight and isn't any heavy duty plastic but if you're a bit careful and don't drop it, drop things on it, throw it, or otherwise abuse it I don't think it's a problem. It is a little big but nothing extreme, and in the case of resin work it's better that way because you can fit larger molds in. I'd hazard a guess that molds the size of the Mod Podge molds would fit (all of mine are smaller at the moment).

It's not noisy, it doesn't produce heat that I've noticed, and the bottom tray/panel does come out (it doesn't always slide easily). It did come with the bulbs packaged with styrofoam inserts to keep them from breaking. They were installed already and it worked straight out of the box. There aren't any instructions but they've got those here on this page so it's not an issue.

title: Highly recommended. Excellent product.
text:
If anyone asks, I love argan oil products. It is the best discovery to ever happen to this fair, sensitive skinned, fine haired person EVER. I started out trying the shampoo because I like to use different products and see how they work in the Argan oil field. I was not disappointed. Hands down the best shampoo I have ever put on my head. I usually have two different shampoos to alternate every other day in my shower. No more. I only need this shampoo.
The conditioner is also well worth the money. My hair is conditioned but not greasy or weighed down. I have a lot of hair. But it is baby fine and will tend to plaster to my head and look greased with some products. Thankfully, not this conditioner. And I can use it every day.
Our water is treated and very hard. My hair is usually dry and I have to use thick, deep conditioning products and moisturizers in the shampoo. Not with this duo in my shower. This is all the product I need. I would highly recommend this product and am not disappointed.

title: Organic hydrating, reduces the signs of aging and sun damage!
text:
I have lived in Florida almost my entire life, and at 49 years old, I have spent an obscene amount of time in the sun, especially as a child with no protection. We did not know that much about sun damage and so no one used sunscreen.
THOUGH, my skin is not in terrible shape, i do have fine lines and some slight discoloration on my face, I have freckles and as I have aged, there are a couple of spots where I am not happy with how they look.
I was offered this Organic Facial Moisturizer from Plus 1Skincare for free or at a reduced rate for my honest review. I have to say, I am impressed. the bottle is a generous size, the product is smooth and goes on light, without feeling heavy on my skin. It is considered a body butter, which is fine, I used to put just coconut oil on my face every night prior to trying this product. This contains coconut oil, grapeseed oil, green tea, juniper oil, kelp, rosehip, peppermint, parsley, papaya, burdock, celery, echinacea, spirulina, ginger, honey, coenzyme Q10. Each of these natural ingredients are known for being very hydrating and for reducing the signs of aging.
My skin feels softer and looks brighter. I highly recommend this for your skin care regimen.

title: ~ Softening and Smoothing with a Delicious Light True Citrus Scent. ~
text:
I have medium length naturally wavy, processed hair that tends to be frizzy if I don’t use good hair products, especially conditioner. After coming across this conditioner, it sounded perfect for my hair, so I decided to give it a try. The bottle itself is streamline and attractive, containing all of the pertinent information such as ingredients, directions, cautions, company information, and Made in the USA. I like that it is also paraben-free, sulfate-free, cruelty-free, organic, and vegan. The easy flip-top lid is very helpful in dispensing the conditioner and I am always happy when a product comes with a tamper-proof seal in place, as this did.

This conditioner is beautifully creamy, thick, and rich and smells wonderfully fresh and citrusy, uplifting and delicious, and is perfect for men and women. I have been washing my hair as usual, applying this conditioner and then using a wide-tooth comb to remove any tangles, after which I leave the conditioner on while I shave my legs and wash my body. This gives the conditioner a little extra time to do lovely things for my hair. I then gently pat my hair dry with my towel, apply a light Argan serum, and then let it air dry the rest of the way. I love how soft and smooth this conditioner makes my hair feel.

title: Gets the job done.
text: I've used electric razors in the past and was using a Remington prior to getting this one. Compared to the Remington, this one felt like it had less power but still gets the job done. It doesn't pull or pinch at all. It fits and feels well in my hand and you can use it wet or dry which is also nice having the waterproof option. It seems to work better/closer on the cheeks than it does the neck/jaw but overall it does do a good job. The pop up trimmer is very good, and provides plenty of power. Battery life seems to be fantastic and it has a charge indicator so you know how much power you have left. To clean it you can just rinse it off making it easy to clean. Overall its a decent razor that gets a close shave, without burns.

title: Luxurious
text:
I've always wanted a bath pillow as it seems like the lap of luxury. This one is very lux and it even comes with a bag of rose petals to take the experience over the top. My only problem is that my pre-teen nieces, who visit often, have commandeered my bathtub just to lay back and soak. No more bath toys for them.

This spa-style pillow also comes with a washer bag. You can hand wash or toss it in the machine for more thorough laundering. It has its own hook to hang dry. Just make sure it's not hung outside the tub or it will drip on the flooring. I like to hang mine outdoors in the sun.

The large face and multiple "razers" on this electric razer makes shaving pretty quick and comfortable.  The shape of it also makes it easy for shaving your head and you can get it done in the shower if you want since it is water proof.  One critique is that the shaver that comes out of the size is too small, but that is really only for sideburns and not for shaving your head.  The nose hair trimmer is excellent, too.  Battery life so far has been satisfactory.

title: Great value, superior product for hair care!

There's no smelly or fake scents, ingredients are all natural, and my hair looks better!  Really a wonderful product and efficient/conscientious seller.  Especially recommend if you have hair like I do, dry and damaged at the ends.  My root area tends to be oily, but this Argan Oil set works so I don't have any "issues" with that.  Most products ... IF they work on the dryness ... they end up making the scalp area look greasy.  This is the perfect balance.

title: If you like Thierry Mugler's Angel, NEST's Cocoa Woods, or Elizabeth and James' Nirvana Bourbon.
text:
I've sampled an earlier version of Pinrose's petals before and wasn't really impressed with the tiny square they used to use (as shown in the product photos). It looks like they got smart with this newer version by having a folded up, soft, fragrance wipe (about 6'x6") in each packet. It definitely makes for a much more versatile sampling experience. I generally prefer using fragrance on the back of my neck and on my collarbones and the wipe was great for that as well as running it over my hair, arms, back of the knees, etc. It's ultimately not strong but I was amazed at the staying power (6+ hours)!

Initially I didn't care for Gilded Fox as a scent. It was very masculine straight out of the package and the cacao note was more bitter than I was expecting. Once it was on my skin and there was a bit of a dry down coming out I fell in love.

title: Not moisturizing.
text:
[[VIDEOID:4eaf048eb55433860172118977ad0ff1]] I’ve used the entire box, exactly as directed and cannot recommend this product.

The only things I liked about this product is that it’s unscented and the packaging is kind of fun, but that is absolutely outweighed by the possibility cutting yourself.

It does not do what it says. It doesn’t provide “intensive plumping” or”improve skin elasticity” which are just ridiculous claims, particularly when you consider this used for one week and the first two ingredients are water and glycerine. I have pure glycerine and after mixing it with water in various percentages, I’d be comfortable betting that this product is at least 70% water.

I was able to cleanly snap all seven ampoules using the plastic topper provided. Even though my snaps were clean the edges of both pieces are sharp and you shouldn’t touch them. It took me several tries to figure out how to get all the serum out of the ampoules. For three days I was tapping the opening on my palm which didn’t feel great, but I just couldn’t get it to pour out cleanly.

Although it is almost as liquid as water, if you get the opening of the ampoules covered with the liquid it won’t come out because of surface tension. If this happens just turn the bottle open side up and blow on the liquid until the opening is clear and you’re good to go.

If you can tilt the bottle just right you can get the serum to pour out. It’s tricky, but spend the time doing it that way and you’ll save yourself a lot of frustration. You see me getting it right in the video, but even then I had to blow the ampoule open once.

There is also the cost. $50.00 for one week of use. That’s about $200 a month and $1250 a year although it does specify that you should use this daily for six weeks, maximum. Why? Is that concerning to anyone else? Anyway, even if you have money to burn you would do well spending it on a procedure from a dermatologist or a flight to Dubai for vacation. This is absolutely ridiculous.

APPLICATION: Goes on fairly oily and blends pretty well. Immediately brings color to my face, I have medium skin and it starts with an apricot redness but fades back to an awakened tone. I really enjoy that about this, I see others complain about this so maybe it's not best for fair skinned people?.

Once dry, I am left with a matte sheen that is well hydrated. You expect it to feel oily but it's more like a raw feel. A really nice balance of hydrated but not wet and definitely softer. I really enjoy this product as well as their others I've tried and will happily continue to use this as my nightly regiment.

title: Unique Hair Toy
text:
I've never seen anything quite like this invisibobble hair toy before. It's a completey new approach for curly-cord scrunchies since you put them on the same way you would put a twist-tie on. Wrap it around your hair and twist the two beads together to lock it into place. Then untwist the beads later to remove it.

The beads are nice and smooth and the curly cord is tightly wound and firmly attached to each bead, yet quite flexible. My beads are pink, which I adore, but I can already tell that I'd love to have them in lots of colors or designs.

The whole thing is smaller than I thought it would be. For some reason, I thought it would be about the size of those figure-8 ponytail holders with a bead at each end that we used to wear when we were little. It's much smaller than those. It's 2.5 inches (6.35 centimeters) from end to end if I just lay it on a table. I managed to comfortably stretch it out to 7 inches (17.78 centimeters) and it could surely stretch more, but I didn't want to force it.

2.5 inches isn't very much when it comes to wrapping it around the base of a pony tail or braid, though, so you'll most likely need to stretch it to put it on. That's a bit tricky to get the hang of, but you can mess around with it on someone else's hair or the ends of your hair if it's long or on a few strands from your mop or a twisted-up handkerchief or anything soft you can wrap it around. Once you get a feel for how to work it, you can use it in your hair.

It's designed to only need to wrap around your hair once, so it doesn't need to be very long. That said, I'd love a much longer one that I can wrap around my ponytail several times. That would make it so I could wrap it around the base of my bun as well, which would be a very cute look. I suppose you could get creative and twist several of these together to form a longer one with lots of beads along it. That would be extra cute, because you'd end up with several beads around your pony tail or bun.

In looking at it, I worried that it would eventually stretch out and no longer work, but apparently the company already thought of that and it's not an issue. If the cord stretches out, you can coil it tightly again simply by dropping the invisibobble into hot water for a few seconds or blowing on it with a blow dryer or setting it in the sun or dangling it above a heater. That's great news and encourages me to experiment with this thing and see how many ways I can figure out to use it.

Some folks have mentioned that these get tangled up in their hair while others have said they never tangle in their hair. I'm one of the people whose hair the invisibobble likes to get tangled up in. I suspect it has to do with whether your hair is straight or not. My hair has a bit of a wave to it, so it likes to grab onto (or be grabbed onto by) whatever it encounters. That said, if it gets tangled around your hair or if your hair gets tangled up around it, you can wiggle the cord to separate the coils and your hair will slide freely between them. Everything on the invisibobble is smooth, so you'll always be able to unwind or pull your hair out of it without pulling any of your hair out of your head or breaking any of it.

For those of you who get one and decide that it's not a hair toy you're comfortable using, it would make a great and very cute bag-tie or you could use it as a cord-keeper for cell-phone cords, etc. It has the added advantage in that you can put it on and take itthem off with one hand, freeing up your other hand to hold the coiled-up cord that you're managing. Not only that, but if you use it as a cord-keeper and want to use the cord, you can untwist the invisibobble, unwind the cord, and twist the invisibobble right back onto the cord, which will hang onto it for you until you need to put it away again. Then, all it will take is a quick untwist, coil, and twist to put the cord away.

title: An OK addition to your natural hair care regimen
text: I bought this trio after reading glowing reviews from a few natural hair influencers that I follow on YouTube and Instagram.  I like that the products are all natural.  In all honesty, I really wanted to like the entire trio.  The product I liked most was the whipped shea butter - I used every bit!  The texture was nice, but nothing I couldn't really make myself - I have every single ingredient in my DIY arsenal.  The black soap shampoo was just ok... again, I have the same products, so I could probably have made this myself.  Plus, the smell was a little off-putting.  The mango butter was really disappointing.  I know this is beyond the seller's control, but it arrived melted.  I thought maybe it would solidify after I stuck it in the refrigerator, but it didn't.  I added some raw cacao butter to thicken the texture, and it helped some, but the texture was still goopy and grainy.  I hate waste, so I use this as a body butter and after I shampoo because it does help to retain the moisture in my hair.  All-in-all, the products were okay.  But the quality (in my very humble opinion) do not justify the price.

title: Incredibly disappointed

I was so excited to try these lashes!
They seemed to go on and adhere well at first and then after a few hours they lifted all the way up.

Turns out they were sticking well because of the excessive glue used to keep them in place in the packaging.

There are only 2 magnets and they aren’t on the very ends of the strip. Because of this the end starts to lift and then the entire lash comes off.

For whatever reason they don’t seem to be reusable either because even after cleaning them and reapplying the liner the magnets never stuck again.

title: Sweepa's better! ..Limp-Uppers & Limp-Lowers = DeCepTive
text:
The upper bristles are limp.
The lower (suction cups) are limp as well.
Limp bristles + Limp suction = junk!
...(compare Easyfeet's limp bristles to the rubber bristles on SWEEPA!
......now why couldn't they have used Sweepa bristles on Easyfeet?

While the concept seems cool when viewing the ads, the reality is otherwise. In chrono order:

(1) First I had read the many poor reviews of easyfeet.
(2) Then I phoned Easyfeet, whereupon the guy insisted that the suction is excellent and the reviews were not true.
(3) So I found a place to buy this cheap, since I wanted them for a senior citizen
(4) Upon receipt I confirmed that the poor reviews proved correct. The suction cups are the kind which are LIMP & SHALLOW instead of "firm/resilient rubber".

Having bought & tried many bath mats over the years, I have experience with both good & bad suction cups. You'd be surprised how many bath mats have flat/limp suction cups. I had bought once a PVC bath mat from a reputable company which had similar limp cups. Upon complaining to them, they immediately replaced it with an identical mat, BUT this time, the model number was different. Because they knew full well that the latter model had deeper/firmer/resilient suction-cups which actually work, instead of shifting around!

(5) Finally, as stated previously, the bristles of easyfeet are a bad joke. (the upper ones) More like the bristles of a baby brush than the type to give a massage, the way the lower ones are. But actually, all of them are sorta scratchy. Instead, they should have used SWEEPA type of bristles. (see online images)

Very deceptive world we live in...

title: I think I'm in love!
text:
If it is possible to be in love with a toothbrush, then I'm in love with this toothbrush. It is wonderful, with its five different be settings, there is surely a speed that will work for you. This is the first electric toothbrush that I have owned that has more than two speeds. The 'White' setting works for me. My Oral B and Phillips Sonicare never got my teeth as clean as this Kissliss does.

It is great that the toothbrush comes with two regular brush heads and two sensitive ones. It also comes with a facial brush, which is a good idea in theory, but the bristles are way too soft to be effective. The toothbrush also comes with a travel case. The overall product and packaging makes it a real value for the price.

I think that a feature that is missing is a little bit bigger base that could hold a brush head. When I tried out the facial brush there was no where for me to place the toothbrush head. The larger base with brush head holder would also be helpful if two people were sharing the toothbrush or if I wanted to keep the toothbrush head and the facial brush head out to have easier access to them.

title: Works Best On Fine Lines or Marks
text:
I found this to do a nice job of smoothing the skin and minimizing some of the finer marks and flaws. It left the treated areas looking more universal as a whole, and the skin feeling more soft and smooth tho the touch. I could see a lessening or lightening of the color in some marks, but they did not all disappear. The marks that were recent, thin or fine to begin with seemed to do better with this cream than the ones that had been around longer or were larger in size.

This was easy to apply and didn't seem to leave much of a residue behind. It takes a bit more than some of the thinner creams I have tried, but applies more thickly and evenly too. I had no staining or damage to my clothing when using this either. There is a slight smell to this cream. It is a medicinal smell, almost minty to me but it is there.

*A sample item was provided for review purposes.

title: Decent Shave - Cheap Build
text:
My wife bought the Philips Norelco 8140XL for me as I'd been complaining (her patience ran out) about the battery failing in my Norelco 7885XL shaver. I tend to complain a long time before I get around to getting something like that fixed.

The first shave with the 8140XL was just ok. The shaver runs quietly until you actually shave. The heads are straining in their cheap plastic support frame. Philips Norelco has really cheapened the product if this is any example.

The build quality of the 8140XL is just plain cheap. The plastic seems to be the same type found in the cheapest consumer electronics components these days .. that silver powdery look. That must be why the shaver doesn't weigh much The shaver is constructed of it as is the 'automatic charging stand' that's just a base with a pass-through wire from the plug-in charger. The plug-in charger cable isn't coiled. It's a cheap long black thin cable, way too long for the average bathroom vanity, and probably won't last.

I'm not sending this back. It's something to use while my 7885XL gets repaired and will sit in the cabinet beyond that. The 7885XL shaver is well constructed. The plug-in charger has a nice coiled cord.

title: Know before you buy...
text:
I was disappointed even before opening the package. I could see through the clear plastic, that the flowers were definitely all smashed up. Plus, the picture and description shows 1 flower per clip, but the clip actually had two flowers and so was to big for my purpose.
I should have listened to the other reviews that complained about the flowers being wrinkled. I saw another review that said they ironed it, but I dont see how these could be ironed at all. Even if there was a way to iron these, it still wouldn't look right. It was of poor quality. I could not use these clips at all.
I ended up finding Hibiscus Clips at the "99 cent only store" (2 hibiscus clips in one pack for 99 cents) and they were beautiful ! Did not need ironing.
The company did give me a refund

title: Good looking Gorilla Cutter, just be careful washing
text:
My son loves Gorillas and we told him we would make Gorilla cookies with him. You do not know how hard it is to find a Gorilla cookie cutter so of course i went to Amazon. After looking I chose this one for the price and it looked good. It seemed decently quality for a plastic cutter (would prefer metal) and worked great the first time. Knowing I shouldn't put this in the dishwasher i hand washed it like I normally would any plastic food item, soak it in water, scrub, rinse and dry. Well went back to use it again and the heat from the water caused it to warp. Not too bad but my son (3 years old) now needs help since it takes some tricky maneuvering to make it look like the gorilla.

So beware, works and looks good just be careful when washing.

text: Initially, I thought this would be too heavy of a cream for my skin because it's very thick. I have combo, clog-prone skin with some acne and feared this would break me out, as most products this rich do. I almost threw it away but decided to give it a try. It's extremely hydrating and hasn't broken me out at all. If you have oily or combo skin this will probably be too heavy for summer but it's great for winter. If you have dry skin, you might love this year-round. Acne girls, I think this one is safe for us (at least, it is for me). I use it day and night and it makes my skin so soft and hydrated. I usually take issue with most face products - I am PICKY - and I like this cream a lot. Really appreciate the good price and ingredients. I'll probably purchase it again. I'd recommend it to anyone.

title: Very Nice but Probably Won't Switch my Brand
text:
I purchased this pack of ponytail holders which includes 3 sets/types of holders in a variety of colors. I received scrunchies which are not really my style but are nice and come in good neutral colors and two different thicknesses of hairbands. I typically use these when getting ready in the morning, to separate my hair into layers when straitening and also when I go to the pool or beach, as well as when I am at the gym. I appreciated that there were different thicknesses depending on how strong a hold you needed.

I have thin hair and I found the thinnest bands seemed to hold best without pulling on my hair. I used them at the gym and found that they held up well through my workout. Like any band they stretch a little over time which I actually prefer because they adjust to fit your hair the best. Eventually as like with all ponytail holders I have used these seem like they may stretch out too much over time but they were durable and I didn't have an issue in the few weeks I have used so far so I don't think there is a longevity issue.

The one thing I did not like about these holders is that they have a plastic piece at the connection of the band. To me this was the only but important con and the reason I probably wouldn't switch brands. However, this is not unique to this brand and if that doesn't bother you these are a great option. They come in a variety of colors and were of good quality. If anything this piece will probably help them last longer but for me I have worries about hair snagging. Although I will still continue to use the ones I have it is not my first choice. I think if you are careful while using them there wouldn't be an issue.

**I have received the product for free or at a discounted price for purposes of giving my honest review. I was not given any additional compensation or been otherwise influenced by anyone at the Company. I have thoroughly inspected the product prior to writing my review for the product and the views expressed here are my own, based on my personal use and experience with the product. I do not review products unless I fully intend to use the product in my day to day life and I choose products that I think will enjoy and fit my lifestyle.**

title: WORTH THE MONEY!!
text:
Love this polish!! It really works! Colors change in seconds! Caused by temperatures. The consistency of the polish is really good for painting (on your own). The brush is excellent for applying polish. Not too big and not too small. Goldilocks! Yes, polish will peel off easily but to keep it on longer simply scruff your nails well before polishing with a rough grit nail file.
I used 3 coats and it was perfect. Especially after applying a clear top coat. Yes, the bottles are smaller but I saved more for 1 pack of these polishes than had I gone for just one trip to the salon. Plus, you don’t need a lamp. This stuff won’t ruin your nails like the gel polish will. I ordered their other set of colors too!! Excited to try them!! This is totally my new polish!! It’s like wearing two colors. And when it’s chilly out, you get a perfect French manicured looking effect from whatever the cold color is. I get tons of compliments on my polish. I don’t have fake nails so all of this applies to polishing your natural nails. No idea how it would work on acrylics, etc.

title: Great for kids
text: I bought these for my 7 year old because she had trouble distributing shampoo through her hair. She has very curly hair that goes down to her lower back. She would get a blob of shampoo in one area, then couldn't rinse it out completely. This was causing her scalp to itch, and she had dry shampoo flakes in her hair. I would help wash her hair, but she really wanted to be able to do it herself. The first time she used these brushes, she loved them. She was able to get the shampoo all over her scalp, and she liked the massaging effect of the silicone bristles. She has no problem gripping them with her small hands. Her hair is now nice and clean, and her scalp is healthy.

title: Great product and well worth the money
text:
I have my own gel nail kit at home and prefer to paint my own nails rather than go to the salon. I hadn't done gel nails in months because of how tedious and time consuming it was to soak my nails to change polish when my nails grew out, but this product has actually gotten me back in gel. All you have to do is file off your top coat, add the polish remover, wait a few minutes, and the polish with just slide right off! I love it too because I don't have to worry about damaging my nails using a drill to get the polish off either.
The product is safe, almost scentless, and completely painless to use. The price for 2 bottles of this product was actually less than the cost of one bottle of the competitors! I am definitely planning on buying this again if my bottle ever runs out. I've used it 4-5 times now and I still have well over half of the bottle left!

title: Love the curler, meh on the mascara
text: I double applied the mascara just to see a difference. There wasn't much between my natural lashes and the made up ones. I found that my lashes also clumped together. As far as waterproof? In this dismal time of masks I found that i sweat like crazy with it on. My regular mascara is not water proof and inevitability ended up on my upper cheeks. So I had high hopes for this. The odd thing kid I didn't see any mascara running down my face, but at the end if the day I had very little mascara left on my lashes. Hmm. So thus is my take. If you want a really nice lash curler, this would be a good choice. It comes with three additional pads for future use. The handle is held shut by a removable plastic piece. Why, I'm not sure. For packaging? At any rate it works very well. The mascara? I think of it as emergency makeup.

title: Great bottle of fractionated oil, though it doesn't seem to be organic (as the company name suggests)
text:
[[VIDEOID:49719f4b10e5673fb4b009c74e17a8cb]] This is a review of the Fractionated Coconut Oil by Sky Organics 16oz- 100% Pure MCT Oil (Cocos Nucifera) with PUMP. Ideal as a Massage Oil & Aromatherapy. Carrier Oil Made in USA from Sky Organics

Pros:
I love the pump that it comes with - it works great and gives you a consistent amount per pump.
Nice on the skin - doesn't make it overly oily (it makes it seem kinda like when your forehead has oil on it)

Cons:
isn't organic, at least they don't say it is. It feels like they have organics in the name hoping you'll think it's organic

Note:
The pump on mine pumps almost exactly 4ml - you'll want to measure your own, but I like that it's consistent

Conclusion:
First off, fractionated coconut oil is a byproduct of making lauric acid. But once again we have found a good way of putting the byproduct to use. This oil is great on the skin and hair, and has several other properties that make it good for you in general.

Video:
I show the unboxing in the video. If there is something about the video you'd like me to improve, please comment so I can make them better.

Disclosure:
I received this Free or Discounted Product In Exchange For Honest Review (testzon.com). As with all products that I review, I take this review seriously, and it is based entirely on my own opinion of the product. I do update reviews as I find more out about the products. Again, if there's anything about my review that you think I should improve, or questions you want me to answer, please feel free to comment on my review.

title: This is a fantastic all-around kit with lots of choices
text: This is a fantastic all-around kit with lots of choices. The eyeshadows are all shimmery, so if you want more of a matte look this might not be for you. That said, the eyeshadows are well pigmented, easy to blend, and adhere well to my primer. After sitting in the heat for three hours they still looked perfect. The blush colors are also fantastic. Some have a bit of a shimmer, some are matte. Beautiful colors that are great to mix and make your own colors. The lip colors are also nice, with a good variety of colors that again you can mix. The only negatives are that the lip brush provided is VERY small, and the amount of each lip gloss is tiny. I get two to three wears out of each color and then it's gone. Also, not real convenient for bringing with you for touch-ups. But over-all I was thrilled and will get use out of all the products.

title: Great woodsy scent!
text:
My boyfriend has been growing out his beard for over a year and a half now. For the first year he didn’t use any type of beard product such as a oil, balm, etc. Six months ago I bought him several different types of oils and balms to try out and get a feel of what he prefers. Each and every one has their positives and negatives, so he continues branching out and trying other beard oils.
I really like the rustic looking packaging, but he really likes the natural, woodsy smell. I agree too, the smell is fantastic. He prefers to keep different scented beard oils around to fit for “several occasions”, and this is a great and distinct smell! It isn’t too overpowering however, but it is still a great smell.
The dropper coming with the bottle is a plus, because I have noticed that some beard oils are nixing the droppers for some reason. I am super excited that this beard oil is vegan and cruelty free. This is actually the first beard oil I have noticed advertising the fact, which is really important to me.
Great ingredients, great packaging, and worth it for the overall price.
I received this product at a discount in exchange for this review, but no matter what I think this is still a great beard oil! Love the smell and love the benefits of using it!

title: Exactly as pictured
text: This product came exactly as pictured: super long with no shadow root. The color was true to the image as well. Minimal shedding, I used to have my real hair this length and it would shed about the same.. Once putting it on I realized 1) it was way too much hair for me now that I'm used to short hair, and 2) I found the lack of any kind of root to make it very Daenerys Targaryen and costume-y. So I chopped it short, added a shadow root, and rinsed out the ends to try and make the curls fall more naturally at the new length. That's what I have pictured here! It went from a wig that I didn't want to deal with to a cute flirty one I'm excited to wear!

title: shocked how well it worked out
text:
After such a long brutal summer and being outside so much. I was looking for something to help my hair out it taken a beating. This suggested to me that I dry coconut oil to help with dry hair. I also read about all the great benefits of coconut oil and its many uses. But I’d only seen it and a solid form which I’ve tried but it is on the messy side. After finding this organic liquid coconut oil had been extremely happy not only with how healthy my hair looks with many uses that I found it to use it with. Everything from shaving dry skin for my dogs to dry hair. As well as helping with shaving is a pre-moisturizing oil. I don’t know why it took so long to give this a try it makes my day-to-day life so much easier and with just a few pumps this high-quality oil is just what you need for numerous things. I’ve also use this as massage oil with my girl is done a fine job. It does not leave your skin to oily. I’m sure there are more uses I will find as time goes on. If you are looking for an organic coconut oil with numerous uses and is of high quality oil I would highly recommend you give this oil a try. Newly surprised how well it works and how many uses you can find for it.It is cruelty free as well !!! which is a Huge thing for me.

title: Thin hair but great quality for the price
text:
the hair came very quickly and on time. i usually prefer a 13x6 frontal unit bc i have a high hairline but this worked well with a few modifications. i had my wig customized with a widow’s peak by my stylist (it did not come that way) and the hairline was very full and knots needed to bleached 3 times over bc they were thick.

i was surprised how soft and silky the hair was even after washing it. it barely tangles or sheds too. great quality hair if not very highlighted like in the promo pics. i made sure to take photos with no filter so everybody can see the quality of the lace & color.

i didn’t use the bald cap method so you can see my braids in the part but it’s not so bad i have to be bothered by it. the lace blends well with my complexion with no tint. i suggest those with darker skin tones use a lace foam tint or their foundation to color it to match.

overall, good quality for the price & length (i got 26”)

title: Super buy!  Will definitely buy again!
text: I had my brows microbladed a few years ago and it had finally faded.  I went back to being a pencil user but it sucks to have to take the time to do them every morning.  I had bought the Wonderbrow stuff before and it was great but super expensive.  Enter this wonderful product for less than half the cost of the other brand.  It works well, looks natural, and lasts for 3-4 days before I have to touch it up or remove it and reapply.  Just be careful to cleanse around your eyebrows after applying and it will last.  I would highly recommend this product to anyone who wants to fill in their brows a bit and they don't want to spend the time mucking around with them every morning.

title: The GUS 30 oz is a homerun for me!
text:
I bought this mug to use at work for cold drinks, but I tried it out at home and like it so much, that it will probably stay here until I get a second GUS 30oz mug, this time for work. A side note, my cat is also named Gus, which is why I originally ordered this mug

On my first use after washing, I filled it about 2/3 full with ice and then some soda, all evening the ice remained and before bed, I filled up with soda again and ended up leaving about half in the tumbler. The next morning, I checked and the ice was still there and the drink was still as cold as the night before...I took a sip and the drink was not watered down and the fizz had remained....pretty good considering I didn't even put the lid on, which surely allowed a little loss of coldness from the room air.

title: This skin cream is remarkable
text:
I had previously been using prescription-strength 2.5% cortisone cream on a recurring rash on my forehead, continuously for over 2 years to keep it under control. This rash just appeared one day in early December 2014, near my hairline, kept spreading and within a few weeks it had taken over my entire forehead. The rash started to break out on my chin, and my forehead was so swollen that even my eyelids swelled nearly shut. I was in misery, and was using ice packs on my face just to keep the inflammation down a little so I could sleep. Finally I obtained a tube of the strongest cortisone cream available, and that slowly resolved the rash. However, even after it cleared up, it would start to re-appear and I had to keep dabbing small amounts of cortisone cream on it, usually on my hairline, sometimes on my forehead or behind my earlobes.
My skin would break out, get flaky, and itch if I didn't use the cortisone cream. After more than two years of this, I stopped the cortisone for a few days, and again my forehead broke out and became flaky. I had read about Synertek because I was researching colostrum for its gut-healing ability. I requested this Synertek Colostrum Regenerating Skin Cream for a Christmas gift 2016, and received it Christmas Eve. I scrubbed off the flakiness, which left reddish open (but not deep) sores on my forehead, and immediately I started using the colostrum skin cream. In only one day I noticed improvement and healing taking place. Within 2 days, my rash cleared up. I was amazed.
On occasion, the rash does re-appear if I have eaten something that I react to. But as long as I keep using this colostrum cream, it clears up quickly, and I become aware of yet another food that I am apparently allergic to.
After using cortisone for so long, this colostrum cream is near-miraculous to me. Thank you, Synertek. Because of this, I now also use the colostrum powder, the skin serum, and the eye cream. And I just ordered the liquid for my son's nosebleeds and for abrasions.

title: Great value and helps me add great volume to my curls.
text:
I am in the middle of some much needed hair TLC and embarked on a curly journey to restore my shoulder length 3a,3b, and 3c curls. I have been using the same diffuser for about 15 years (!) and was rigging it to fit my current hair dryer (my old one came with a hair dryer I had many moons ago and I could not find a good replacement). I saw this item on Instagram and thought it would be a great answer to my problem + the added bonus of making it easy to travel with.

I am VERY happy with my decision. It fits my hair dryer perfectly and stores away nicely (it also allows me to give my old, faithful diffuser a break!).
The basket portion of the diffuser is generously wide, so styling is easy as it feels like it is cradling my hair. I use low heat, or no heat, and my curls come great with every use. The materials used are light, yet sturdy. Last but not least, the price.. it's a great value for the price. I would definitely recommend this item to anyone else looking to add to their curly girl arsenal.

title: Sweet, lovely, smells just like the name
text:
I am not an impulse buyer. So before I spend $$$ on a parfum, I did some extensive research. First, I knew I wanted to have a Tom Ford because of his reputation in making parfum. Then I narrowed down the choices to the 5 most preferred private blends by online reviewers. Then I bought .5ml sample for each. After trying them one by one, my husband made the choice for me: Noir de Noir, but my favorite is Amber Absolute.

Vanilla Tobacco is really sweet and nice, with straight forward vanilla tabacco notes. Vanilla is sweet and yummy. The tabacco smells like Turkish tobacco: sweet and sexy. I can imagine that whoever wears this could be quite irresistible. This is one of my favorite. However, compared to Noir de Noir, I feel that it lacks a bit complexity. It is a bit straight forward Vanilla and tobacco.

From my research and trial, I find that parfum is very personal, and you have to try it in person. It is better to try it at home and wear it once or twice before you buy it at a store. The 5 scents I tried:

- Noir de Noir: complex, sweet, lovely scent. Not overwhelmingly floral, not overpowering, and not sharp/edgy. This is my husband's favorite when I wear it.

- Vanilla Tobacco

- Amber Absolute: Unique, herbal. Stronger than Noir de Noir. Initially, I couldn't stand Amber Absolute. It smelled to me like Chinese medicine box. But then I am totally in love with it. It is very unusual. It has a very unique dried herb fragrance and very complex. It reminds me of the fragrance in the air in Big Sur, CA or Mono Lake, CA when the flowers and plants are drying in fall. The fragrance is not floral, not particularly sexy or feminine.

- Tuscan leather: couldn't stand it, very leathery.

- Neroli Portofino: didn't like it at all. Just like some reviewers said, it smells like Tide.

title: Milk Perfume
text:
Just received Milk perfume by K.Hall Designs and I love it! I ordered the candle from this line earlier so that I could have an idea what the perfume smells like and I have to say that the two is very close in scent, except in the perfume I can detect a hint of coconut that I wasn't able to in the candle (even though it's suppose to be there, but maybe that's just me). Milk is not overly sweet at all, it is a perfect balance between creaminess and sweetness, a mellow concoction that is very comforting, a darling little scent that delivers creaminess with a hint of vanilla and coconut. Because it is not a serious scent, it might appeal to a younger audience or to those that normally don't wear perfume. I think it is excellent in the winter time when one uses moisturizers such as almond, honey, vanilla, cocoa etc. as it does combine really well with these scents. In fact, I bought Milk to go with L'Occitane's Almond line and I must say it layers very nicely with it. Like I said, this is such a simple scent, but by no means it is cheap, gaudy or car-freshener like, it reminds me a little of those baby-colognes that you can buy..but a little more grown up.

Update 1/30/2012:
..so, I've been using this perfume for a few weeks now and I noticed that it turns a little too coconutty. When I compare the scent of the candle and the perfume, I can definitively detect more coconut in the perfume, like I said before, and it just has a toasted coconut with a hint of vanilla scent. I much prefer the milky-vanilla scent of the candle, without the overload of the coconut. I think a more appropriate name for this perfume would be "Coconut".
As far as lasting power goes..it's not bad for a perfume.

I hadn't worn any kind of perfume for years because of this problem.... then I found this product. Since it's a food based smell, it doesn't trigger any headaches. It's very light and subtle so unless you're close, you won't smell it. I enjoy the Grapefruit and Berry scents and have worn them for years. title: Test Small Amounts Sparingly First
text: I decided to purchase some castor oil at the recommendation of a friend to promote hair/lash growth.  The order was prompt and packaged well.  I love the bottle that it comes in, and it serves as a bonus cute decoration in my bathroom.  I applied the oil to my top and bottom lashes with a q-tip at night to promote hair growth.  After a few days of this, I noticed that I started to develop several chalazions in my eyelids which form when oil glands in the eyelid become blocked/clogged.  I also tested a little bit out on my face as a moisturizer and noticed that a small pimple formed the next day.  After giving the regimen a rest, I have slowly begun to try to apply it again and it doesn't seem as though any new chalazions are forming, so maybe it was purely coincidental.  I kept the four stars because the quality of the oil is good and it seems to be a fair price for what you get.  I would just encourage anyone to use sparingly and test small areas of skin first before liberally applying anywhere.

title: Awesome Blossom! REVIEW UPDATED - Broke after 2 months.
text:
This little gadget is awesome. The only reason I am giving it 4 stars is because it took me some time to get acquainted with the settings and how they function. I did read the manual which was helpful but in the end it was trial and error that got me through it. Basically, if anything on screen is blinking that particular feature is in set up mode. You click the opposite button to then opt out and go on to the next feature. The features are R, L, Temperature and Time. Don't worry this review will clarify a few of your questions. Once you get past how to operate the settings, it works great! It is automatically is set to start on Celsius. The hottest temperature is 200 degrees Celsius which is the same as 390 degrees Fahrenheit. Since I use it on the hottest temperature I leave it on 200 degrees Celsius so I don't have to change it to Fahrenheit all of the time. If you want to change it to Fahrenheit you can do this by clicking both buttons together 4 times. What I didn't know until after I used it is that you can change the direction in how the curling iron rolls, either clockwise or counter clockwise. This is represented with an L for Left and a R for Right. So next time I am going to reverse from L to R when I curl the other side of my hair. Pretty neat. Another thing to note is that you have to choose how many seconds you want to curl your hair. I choose 8 seconds. The roller will spin your hair for about 6 seconds and then stop. Do not pull your hair out yet. It will begin to start beeping until the amount of time you selected is over. The beeping will stop and this is when you can easily release the button and pull your hair out. If you abide by this feature you will ensure that you get even curls all around your head. It works best when you use small bundles of hair at a time. I tried to be lazy and my hair got caught up in it. If this happens don't panic. This device is actually really user friendly. Just release the button and slowly push it and release, push and release until it unrolls your hair. Do not just yank your hair out. I curled my hair at work during my break time. I charged it at my desk with PC. It was so simple that I did not require a mirror. It was so convenient. I loved not having cords to mess with. It takes about 4hrs to fully charge. Once fully charged it will last about an hour. It only took me 10-15 minutes to curl my hair but I noticed that I can only use twice without charging it or it will run out of power. For this reason I make sure to charge it after each use so that it's ready for when I need it. Make sure to unplugged it after it's fully charge so that you don't ruin the lithium battery. If you do forget to charge it and run out of power it will operate if it's plugged in with a USB cord. It is portable, lightweight and the outer casing does not get hot to the touch. Not once did I fear I was going to burn my neck or hand. Love this! Oh also, it will automatically shut off after 10 minutes if you forget to turn it off. I highly recommend for adults, teenagers and even younger girls. I just wish the settings will hold in place so that you don't have to go through this step each time before use. Regardless, I am still on board! A+++ Enjoy!

REVIEW UPDATE: I am submitting an updated review because the curling iron stopped working after a couple of months. I do not curl my hair every day and it still broke on me. During mid-use the digital screen started going out on me and it began making one long continuous ringing noise. I could not power it off no matter how hard I tried! I had to put it in another room and let it ring for a couple of hours until the battery died. I have not tried powering it on again in fear that the same thing will happen again. It's as good as broken to me and I will not be using it anymore. It was great while lasted.

title: Exceptional Lip Balm
text:
This is an exceptional lip balm. The tube is smaller size than "regular" lip balms so it fits easily in any pockets. It is probably good for men as well, who don't carry purses, being black in color and having such a discreet size, you can barely feel it in a pocket.

Despite the smaller size, there is a lot of lip balm in it. The whole tube is filled with it. The mechanics are outstanding, the bottom cap is turning smooth with the precision of a Swiss watch. It gives you the feeling of elegance and luxury.

The lip balm itself takes effect immediately, you will feel your lips smooth and flexible right away, it is almost an overwhelming sensation in the first couple of seconds. It has a nutty smell and taste, I would actually gladly spread it over bread for breakfast. it feels natural and edible. It reminds me of the freshly made cookies of grandma. It is an exceptional natural lip balm that you cannot believe you just found given all the chemicals out there.

Along with the exceptional lip balm there are other samples from the same awesome company as you can see in the picture.

title: Amazing serum
text:
This Retinol serum is a combination of retinol and natural ingredients for a high-strength serum containing repairing agents for wrinkled, non-elastic, and stressed skin. It is designed to provide smoother-looking skin and rejuvenate aged and dull skin.

In addition to retinol, this serum contains Aloe, Hyaluronic Acid, Vitamin E and Green Tea for gentle and effective hydration. Hyaluronic acid is a glycosaminoglycan, a very long chain of disaccharides (sugars) present in all connective tissues that is responsible for retaining moisture. As we age, levels of hyaluronic acid fall—some say by as much as 50 percent. Genetics, smoking, and magnesium and zinc deficiencies appear to accelerate this loss, but it happens to all of us to some degree.

One of the benefits of hyaluronic acid is its effectiveness at maintaining healthy, youthful skin. The reason is because hyaluronic acid is an essential component of the skin. Thanks to its ability to promote collagen production and retain hundreds of times its weight in water, hyaluronic acid keeps the skin plumped up and hydrated.

The combined benefits of these ingredients make for an amazing anti-aging and nourishing moisturizer for your skin.

title: Excellent magnetic lashes!
text: I love these. I like that they are mink. And I especially like how they have the little case with a mirror. That’s impossible to find. They work great and stay on my whole 12 hour shift. They are waterproof and you can’t scrub off with just water, not that a person would try. Cold cream works ok. But if you get some lash cleaner or makeup remover and apply to the end of a cotton swab and gently rub along lash, they practically fall off in seconds. At first, I was peeling them off because I thought since it’s magnetic that’s all that’s sticking. But then it’s hard to get the eyeliner off. After using a remover it’s much better. Don’t worry if you have trouble using liquid eyeliner. I promise after practicing a time or two, it will work perfect. If you get out of line, very quickly wipe off excess. It dries quickly. If it takes longer to put them on after applying liner, it will probably still work good. If you put lashes on sooner than you are supposed to and it’s not dried as well as it should be, it still works. It’s just a little messier for the lashes after removing them. I’ve learned to also use my lash remover or makeup remover to clean my lashes afterwards. They will have some liner dried to them and this builds up. I put them in my palm and squirt some on and gently rub with my finger or a swab. I don’t take much effort but get some of it off pretty good. They last me a good 5 or more times depending on how bad I bend them putting on lol. That’s another thing, you don’t have to have a real steady hand to apply them. I use my fingers instead of the holder thing. I normally start in the center but sometimes on the inside. You can adjust them if they are too long on one side. You can also trim them. Please don’t do this while they are on lol. I tried this and cut too much off. I was lazy lol. Most the time I have mine bent good to put on. Well, I should say curved instead of bent lol. They aren’t as fragile as they would seem. I love them. Only thing that worries me, if you ever are in an accident with them on and they take you for an MRI , I worry my eyelids will pull off because of the magnetic particles lol. It’s not funny but something to think about. Surely they would wash them off first. Don’t think about it. Try them. After all, beauty comes at a price lol.

title: Great color but silicone’s a deal breaker
text:
I got this color so I wouldn’t have to dye my hair quite as often.
I dyed my hair with fuchsia fatale about two weeks ago. I usually wash 2-3 times a week. So far it’s been holding up nicely. The smell was pleasant as well. I don’t like all those sweetly fruity smells other direct dyes come with. I can try to update as it washes it over time.

What I did not like:
- the amount of dye. I only dyed part of my head, the rest is shaved, and I still ran out of dye. With the same amount of dye from a different brand I can almost dye my hair twice. Probably because this is rather thick

- the fact that it contains silicone. I did not see that until too late. So I’ve been washing with a clarifying shampoo in between to make sure I get them out of my hair. Of course this will affect how long it stays vibrant.

I have gotten so many compliments with this color but the silicone thing is just a no no for me, so I’ll probably not buy it again. I can get this color without silicone from other brands. I guess I’ll just live with dyeing more frequently.

title: customer
text: This product is far too complex for the benefits received.  It has a 30+ page instuction book that it is suggested one reads before using.  I own a Norelco dry shaver electric razor and a panosonic wet shave electric razor.  None shave as close as a cheap Bic or any brand plastic razor.  This razor has a stand for charging and a clipper type of attachment.  By the time you have read the detailed instuction book you have to go back to figure out exactly how to do something.  The cream that comes from the razor is like a lubricant and allows the razor to glide smoothly across one's face.  Nice!  I haven't had to purchase another can so I am relatively satisfied with that feature until I get hit with sticker shock for buying a replacement.  Having used it now for a couple months (they recommend that you use it a few months to get accustomed to it) I consider my evaluation as being legitimate.  I would not purchase this shaver--I could buy a couple years of plastic manual razors and not have to read and reread the instruction manual.  It is far too complex for the purpose at hand.
