title: Love The Fat
text:
Mitchell’s Wool Fat has a reputation of being finicky about the right amount of water. It took me a while to figure it out, but with some tips from the Mitchell’s company, I have come up with this process.

1. When you receive your puck and are ready to put it to use, place it in a container slightly larger than the puck and cover it with water. The Mitchell’s Crock is the perfect size for this.

2. Check the puck every day and top off the water if necessary. When the puck expands to fill the container from side to side, drain the water and leave only enough on the surface to keep it from drying out.

3. Soak your brush in warm, not hot water while you take a shower.

4. Remove the brush from the water and squeeze our the excess. You want the brush wet, but not dripping water.

5. Drain the bloom water off the puck into your lather bowl. If you face lather, use it to wet down your face.

6. Swirl the brush over the top of the soap for about 30 seconds. Add another 30 seconds if you have hard water.

7. If you bowl lather, swirl the brush in the bowl until the bloom water is incorporated into the soap. Add a few drops of water and continue to swirl. Repeat this process until you have the later you desire. Even with too much water, The Fat will provide a slick layer on your face. With the right amount of water, you will get thick rich lather. If you start to get large bubbles in your lather that don’t disappear, then you’ve got too much water. You can fix this by loading more soap from the puck.

7B If you face lather, go from the puck to your face and build the lather by brushing in circular motions on your face. Dip the tips of the brush in warm water to add more water until you have the lather you desire.

8. Shave and enjoy the slickness that only The Fat can provide.

9. Rinse between passes with cold water and again after your final pass.

10. When you are done, apply your alum block to your freshly shaved face, then after about a minute, milk the remaining soap from your brush and use it to clean the alum from your face. Rinse in cold water and perform the rest of your shave routine.

If you decide to purchase a puck of The Fat and put in the time to learn how to lather it, you won’t want to use any other soap. The only thing missing from the fat is a perfume scent. The Fat smells like clean fresh linen. That’s why I only gave it three stars for the scent. I love the smell, but most of you are looking for some artificial flower smell...you won’t find that in The Fat.

title: A shaving-system in a box
text:
This ZAKORA electric shaver is actually an IPX7 water-resistant shaving system that includes brush and trimming accessories to use with the shaver. It also includes a standard razor handle with 3 cartridges. This ZAKORA electric shaver is rechargeable and uses UBC C charging so there's no need to think about taking along a separate micro USB cable if you're taking this ZAKORA electric shaver along with you on a trip.

I used this device for a bit over a month and it held up well. I shave 2-3 times each week using it on both my head and my beard. Being able to use this shave wet or dry is a huge convenience. So is being able to pop off the rotary shaving head to replace it with either of the included trimmers. The items combined with the standard razor make this ZAKORA electric shaver a complete shaving system that helps keep a person well-groomed both at home and while on-the-go.

What I liked most about this ZAKORA electric shaver was:
- Delivered a close, comfortable shave.
- Had enough attachments to keep me from having to use multiple shaving tools to shave my head, manage my beard, and trim any loose hairs between my brows, ears, or nose.
- USB C charging is extremely convenient, especially if you use this ZAKORA electric shaver away from the home.

What I liked least about this ZAKORA electric shaver was:
- 1:1 charging. 90 mins of charging only yields 90 minutes of shaving. A bigger internal battery would have resolved this issue.
- I am not sure how to acquire replacement cartridges for the standard razer that's included in the package.

Overall, if your looking for a complete shaving solution at a great price this Zakora electric shaver should make your shortlist. This Zakora electric shaver comes with everything a person needs to shave their head, manage their beard, and eliminate most loose hairs around the brows, ears, and nose. This shaving kit even has a standard razor handle and 3 cartridges for those occasions when a manual razor is required. I wish this Zakora electric shaver had a bigger battery and there was a way to get more blades for the included standard shaver. However, those are minor issues when weighed against the totality of what's offered in this package and for this price. 4.5 out of 5.0

title: Reviews had me worried, but these worked great on 4100 Philips razor
text:
{I purchased these replacement blades directly from Philips, because I had a discount code. While not purchased from Amazon, these are the same blades I received from Philips.}
I used the SH50 replacement blades for a 4100 series Philips razor. I use my razor not just for my face, but also to maintain my shiny bald head! Therefore, the razor and blades get quite a work out. I wanted to replace the blades some time ago, but the negative reviews concerned me enough that I delayed. Finally, I had to move forward.
I wanted to make sure that I was not going to get blades made by a 3rd party, so I contacted Philips directly to ensure I was getting their blades. The box I received looks exactly like what you see here on Amazon. They also gave me a discount code when I contacted them, which is why I purchased from them.
Upon arrival, I over-analyzed the replacement process because of comments I had read here. At least for the 4100, the replacement was an absolute breeze, and I would have been better off not worrying. You do need to align each of the blades a little, but if you pay attention when you pop out the previous blades, it's simple. The next time I do this, it will take me less than 60 seconds.
In case I didn't like the new blades, I set the old ones aside. Then I waited--3 days--so there was a solid amount of growth to give these new blades a right proper test! As I write this, that test was just completed. The blades passed with flying colors. It's like the razor was brand new again. There was no pulling at all. The shave was smooth, and so is my head. I'm very pleased with how these blades work with the 4100 model.

title: I've used it 3x and it's dead.
text:
Edit:. I did love this system. I am oy on my 3rd use because I moved and haven't found it til just now. It cleaned like 20 eye brushes and when I started to use the bigger brushes, it was like the motor couldn't handle it. So I moved to medium brushes. It cleaned like 3 and now is dead. I can turn it on, the light comes on, but if doesn't spin. I can manually try to spin it, and it will try to spin, but just stops. I get that I've had it a while, but like I said, this is my 3rd time using it. I gave it a full charge, and it died on me. I will try another brand. Maybe that will work better.

I love this brush cleaner. First off, it's high quality. It doesn't feel cheap at all. As a matter of fact, it's better than I expected it to be. There are 3 speeds, the third is supposed to be 13,000 rotations per minute, its what it says in the manual. Idk if that's true, but it does go faster than expected. Also, I cleaned about 100 brushes before it started to slow down (the battery was dying). It doesn't hold every single brush, I think I had to hand wash 1 or 2 of my 150. So it holds most of them with no problem.
I saw people using a second bowl to rinse their brushes, so I tried that, but I realized and could see that the rinse bowl didn't have any soap or makeup in it. There may have been a TINY amount of soap in it, but not enough to justify a clean and rinse of every brush. I guess if I didn't have like 150 to clean, I could do both, but some how when you pull the brush out of the water/soap, and it's spinning, the water and soap spin out, so the brush is actually clean and doesn't need a rinse.
Also, I like that the device is rechargeable. I've heard so many stories, on YouTube in the comments, of people getting a device like this and it being run on batteries. They say you have to change them a lot. And you never know when they'll run out, so you have to keep extra batteries on hand. This charges up relatively quick, but it wasn't completely dead any time I recharged it, I just plugged it in when it started going a little bit slower than normal.
Anyway, I love this and will keep my brushes cleaner than they've ever been because I can go from a dirty brush, open the cupboard, soap, water, device, clean and dry in under 2 mins. If everything is set up, I can go from dirty to clean and dry brush in about 30 to 45 seconds, depending on the thickness of the brush. An eye brush can be dirty and cleaned, ready to use in UNDER 30 seconds. It's amazing. Buy it! You won't regret it. I promise!

title: So far, so good
text: I have thinning, baby fine, 3B curls that frizz easily.  I used this treatment and it certainly took my curls away and made my hair smooth and shiny.  It smells kind of bad though, powdery and old ladyish during the treatment and for 2 days afterwards, even with washing with sulfate free shampoo.  My hair is super shiny now and is looking better.  The first 2 days after treatment my hair looked really thin, baby soft and flyaway and straighter than ever!  I am liking it better as the body and wave are slowly returning. It still seems thin.  I'll use it again.  I like that it is forymalydehyde-free and you don't have to keep it in your hair for 3 days like other salon treatments.  The salon treatments gave me face flushing and sweating reactions from the formalydehyde and smelled awful as you flat ironed it--toxic fumes!  None of that with this product--just that crappy powder smell and more straightening results.  The shine is similar.  Expensive, but I used a quarter of the bottle.

Sept 2020: This arrived yesterday, so I used it this morning. I LOVE IT! My hair looked and felt fabulous and it was so easy to use.
Two days ago I tried my friend's $99 version and this model was just as good. It is well made and the components are equal or better than the more expensive model. I'm so glad I gave the HAUSBELL Hair Dryer Brush a chance and saved at least $60.
Update, April 10, 2021: It died. I have shorter, curly hair; so I do not use this all of the the time. When I turned it on I thought is sounded odd, but like I said... I don’t use it every week, so I thought I could be imagining it. Then it made a horrible noise and burned out. I guess I will have curly hair for a while!
Sad that I wasted my money on a product that did not last.

title: The mirror’s surface is damaged by the glue-backed label pasted to it!!
text: This is my second purchase of one of these mirrors.  I like to shave in the shower so the concept of a mirror which I can stick anywhere in shower stall is appealing to me. I ruined my first mirror when I used a standard glass cleaner on it, so my bad. Well I ordered a replacement and it arrived today...great!! What’s not great is that they place a sticky label right across the front of the mirror which does not peel off easily at all, and my attempt to get the sticky pieces off the mirror ended up leaving scratches on the filmy surface of the mirror caused by my fingernails!  How else am I supposed to get this crap off the mirror!  Why would you use a label like this on the face of a mirror that has an easily damaged filmy coating on its surface? Why not use a label that doesn’t have the glue backing and makes it possible to remove it without damaging the surface of the mirror?  This is not cool and I am not pleased.  You’ve ruined an otherwise good product with a stupid gluey label and you’re getting mine back...and I won’t be needing a replacement.

title: clogs constantly
text: I have owned various panasonic beard trimmers for past 20 years, untli the non-replaceable batteries go bad.  This is the first one I have had which sucks the trimmings into a built-in container, which is a great idea.  The problem is it clogs every 2-3 strokes, which makes it unusable.  Now, if you use this on a daily or every 2-3 day basis, and are cutting hairs taht are 1/8" long, for instance, I bet it would work well.  But when you do trimming every 1-2 weeks, and the hair is 1/4" or longer for head hair, it will clog, and this product is not for you.  So I would give it 0 stars if you are like me, or 4 stars if you plan on using it constantly, for an overall score of 2 stars.

title: Love It But...
text: Nice head buzzer/shaver. I have been cutting my own hair for many years now. This has been the most comfortable to use. It fits nicely in your hand, easy to use in any angle, and lightweight. It has a wide blade so you can finish sooner. The 3 blade  settings plus the 3 guides are perfect for doing a buzz fade. The battery charge lasts for a while, usually 3 to 4 buzzing sessions for me. The entire set is also small enough to pack in my suitcase when I travel. BUT...less than a month after I purchased, one of the guides broke. The little tabs that hold it in place while mounted on the unit are gone. They must have broken when I packed them all in a little bag in my suitcase. The manufacturer could improve this by using higher quality, more pliable plastic. Another thing I don't like is that the unit will not operate while it is plugged in, so if you lose charge in the middle of a buzzing session you will have to wait. And the batteries completely recharges in several hours. Since the batteries are nickel cadmium it's a good idea to discharge it completey, and recharge it completely every time or else the battery life will be shortened.  Therefore 4 stars instead of 5.

title: Excellent and Inexpensive Replacement Heads for Oral-B Battery-Operated Toothbrush
text:
I own several Oral-B Pro-Health Clinical Battery Powered Toothbrushes, Type 3744. This model is powered by 2 replaceable AA batteries.

The OEM replacement heads for this unit are rather expensive, as you would expect.

These new Compatible Oral-B Care Electric Toothbrush Replacement Brush Heads Refill, 4 Count list my model as one which these heads will fit.

They do.

And they work as well as any I have used.

At their relatively low price, they are an easy recommendation. I think that, if you own the same model Oral-B toothbrush as I do, and if you try these replacement heads, you will be pleased. I certainly am.

Thank you for reading this and for considering my opinion.

Lawrence H. Bulk

The only issue that I have is the scent, I don't really care for it. When I have used this on my face, the smell lingers. For this reason, I don't use the product. My mother does not find the scent bothersome so I guess it's just a matter of taste.
I myself would not reorder because I won't use something if I don't like the smell despite the results.

title: Beautiful and comfortable headbands!!
text:
These headbands are beautiful. They are both plush and wrapped in velvet fabric and decorated with lots and lots of rhinestones, specifically rhinestones strands/chains attached to the headband.
The headband is comfortable to wear. I have worn them and I am happy to say they don't slip/slide back as I have experienced with others.
The headband is about 3/4 of an inch high or thick. I found that I could wear them as regular headbands or wear them tilted, almost like a tiara, with a hairstyle that can hold them in place. Since it does have rhinestone chains be careful when putting on or taking off since hair will get caught and pull it.
I had an issue with one of the headbands (small rhinestones) coming undone. When I received it two of the strands were unattached. I contacted the seller and they quickly helped to solve the issue.

title: Came With No Safety Seal, Cream Leaked Everywhere, Leaving Jar Half Empty...Disappointing
text:
This comes in a cute pink box, and a cute jar with pink on it. The cap twists off.

Unfortunately, when I received it and was taking it out, I noticed the box had cream all over it. When I opened the box, there was cream all over the jar. When I opened the jar, there was no protective seal (which I’m guessing it how it was able to spill in the first place), and it looked like about half the product was gone (unless it wasn’t completely full to begin with 🤷‍♀️). With no protective seal, I wouldn’t feel comfortable using it on my face. But with the way the world is right now, I definitely don’t feel comfortable using it on my face. That, along with the fact that it had leaked everywhere, I just wasn’t comfortable trying it.

I can say that it has a nice, light scent. And I did rub some onto my hand and it felt nice and creamy, not too thick, and absorbed easily. But, unfortunately, that’s all I can say about it.

I really think if a company is going to produce cosmetic/skin care products, they should include safety seals. Yes, the jar comes in a box, but anything could have gotten in the jar before it was placed into that box. I don’t know anyone that doesn’t feel a little uncomfortable when a cosmetic/skin care product doesn’t have a safety seal. It’s really disappointing because I was really looking forward to trying this.

text: OMG I love this thing. I have thin, fairly straight, medium length hair. It takes a little practice, I found it works best if you hold the iron vertically (pointing down) and wrap the hair from the top down. It makes pretty tight girls that I like to then sleep on, or brush out a little to get that perfect wavy look. The glove sounds like a good idea but, it's too rough to wear and touch your hair with it so I don't use it. I use curling cream on my wet hair and then a little styling spray when it's done. I only wish my hair was longer! LOVE THIS.

title: Easier to apply, strong magnets
text: I have recently fallen in love with magnetic lashes.  This is the fourth set I have purchased, all different brands.  Putting on magnetic lashes takes some practice.  I have found that attaching the outside magnets first works best.  The trick is to keep the other magnets from connecting before they are in the right place.  This set has a full, one piece lash for the top and three small pieces for the underside.  THIS MAKES IT MUCH EASIER!!!  The lower pieces can be easy to lose if your work area (bathroom counter) is cluttered, but can usually be found clinging to something that has metal.  Also, these are the strongest magnets of all my sets and can pinch your eyelid if not placed correctly.

title: Moody Blue is my favorite FUCHSIA lipstick
text: "Mood" lipsticks do not apply the color of the actual lipstick, rather they combine the lipstick color with the color of your lips. It lasts all day even though my lips are prone to getting pretty "peely" even with moisturizing. I've found this at a beauty supply store for $2 but that store has since closed but it's worth the $5 on here. The only drawback I can think of is it is pretty hard to remove so if you're big on removing 100% of your makeup at night, this product might be annoying for you.

title: It's... okay
text: I'm giving Fresh Balls three stars because it works somewhat. It's great in that it goes on easy (much better than applying a powder)and keeps you dry and chafe-free for a couple of hours. The product does NOT keep you very dry, though. FB is a good solution for VERY mild sweat, for instance, if you have a sedentary job in a cool building with temperate-to-cold weather outside.  If you warm up though, you will still get swamp crotch. I think that FB lessens the swamp crotch, and helps it dry quickly. If the price hits $3.00/bottle, then its a good deal. Otherwise, spend the $12.00 on a couple more drinks for the lady, and she won't mind the swamp crotch anyway.

title: Good stuff
text: Love it. It lathers really well even in hard water, cushions my slant razor, rinses easily without leaving a greasy film, and my wife loves the scent. What's not to like? I did not expect this from a puck of hard soap but the triple milling works. Fortunately, it fit into my lathering bowl almost perfectly. All I had to do was use my pocket knife to chamfer the edge of the puck so it would fit st the bottom where the bowl curves inward. Left the shavings in the bottom. Do not melt or microwave as that will destroy the benefits of milling and leave you with something that will not lather. By the way, my technique for lather is to simply moisten the top of the puck with my brush before I shower. Once I get out, I prepare the brush with hot water in the usual way and go to work. The lather jumps up with just a few swirls. I use a Satin Tip synthetic brush that is not stiff.

title: Great Natrual Deodorant!!!
text:
Great product! Give your underarms time to adjust. Toms natural deodorant gave me horrible rashes and offered virtually no odor protection for me. Dove worked for odor protection, but I did not like the chemicals (specifically aluminum) in dove.

Enter Primal Pit Paste. None of the rashes experienced with other natural deodorants, and odor protection!

I definitely went through a 'transition period'- I sweated more, I caught whiffs of odors previously masked with antiperspirant BUT after about 10 days, this lessened immensely. To combat this, I carried my pit paste with me in my purse in case a reapplication was needed.

I plan on this being my go-to deodorant from now on.

title: Excellent red stain
text: This stain is excellent. It does not feather or budge once it sets, and fades gracefully with eating and drinking. Highly pigmented, sheer color. I feel very confident wearing this lip stain. The applicator wand is small, so easy to apply the stain precisely but you do need a steady hand if you’re going for a defined shape. Otherwise you do have a second to smudge it out a little with your finger or cotton swab for a softer, more diffuse look. Works great under gloss for high shine; the stain dries to a fairly dewy look on its own. No transferring. Light fruity scent and slightly sweet flavor. The glass bottle feels of good quality. The color applies as a true red, and gradually fades to a reasonable pink. I like this so much, I have recommended it to a friend. Great value for the price and I have tried many stains seeking the perfect red stain.

title: I'm glad I took the chance
text:
I read through quite a lot of the negative reviews on this product, but decided to go ahead and try it. I'm glad I took the chance. My girlfriend had some serious stains that showed up on her teeth and we wanted something natural to gently remove them since she has extremely sensitive teeth. Sure it's a little messy and is best used at night to avoid any weird comments if the charcoal doesn't completely wash out. It's lightweight, so yes, it can very easily make a mess, but if you read the instructions and use a little common sense, you'll get over it pretty quick. The first use was a learning curve. We both decided to use it. I usually wet my brush and you can use this product on its own, or top off the toothpaste on your brush with this charcoal. If used by itself it does stain much more - your lips and teeth. It's best used before bed like this so you can brush out any residue in the morning. I recommend having a small nail brush handy. With this you can quickly rinse off the charcoal that sticks on your sink - it definitely won't stain the sink permanently.
This is great for surface stains and I've seen a slight color of change with my teeth - but nothing significant enough to say this is a great, strong whitener. If you have sensitive teeth, I recommend use only 2-3 times a week to check sensitivity.

title: Beware
text:
I'm pretty well versed in skin care, and have average skin. I had some mild discolorations from sun exposure and some mild pimples so I decided to give this a whirl having loved the effects of a mild peal at a spa some time ago. I should note I'm only 28 with medium skin tone. Em.. disaster. I rolled applicator tip across my forehead, which gets a lot of sun exposure, and onto one spot on my chin where the pimple had been.

I am now left with a scar-- basically wherever I rolled BHA peel the skin has become very dark and hyper-pigmented, and it's not a "scar" or "scab" i can hope to have come off..rather it's the actual pigmentation of the skin. After initially applying the product i had very little flaking, skin became rather light, then pink like i had suffered frost bite, and then this. I've been trying to cope with the darkness which is not getting any better for THREE WEEKS now. it's a nightmare. Impossible to cover, non of my expensive alpha hydroxy, glycolic, or even pure vitamin e creams have made any difference.

title: One of my all time favorites
text:
I bought this on a whim at a beauty shop in Paris 5 years ago and regretted not buying more than one bottle. I couldn’t find it anywhere that shipped to the US until last year, so I only used my bottle on the most special occasions. I’m so happy I can now buy it here!!!

I love using body oils, especially in the summer, because they just make the skin GLOW. And this scent is my absolute favorite. I don’t go for super feminine floral scents and while I can’t even describe what this smells like (is there a hint of vanilla?) it’s the perfect scent if you want to be smack dab in the middle of masculine and feminine. Sometimes I just put a little bit on the ends of my hair if I’m blow drying it and the scent stays on all day.

I wish they’d redesign the bottle, or at least the sprayer. I have other body oils that don’t even compare to this product, but they have a spray pump that’s much easier to use when I’m in a hurry. I’m afraid of having to push down so hard that the bottle slips out of my slippery hands.

title: Hides bruises well.
text:
When this item arrived upon opening the box I discovered a clear plastic bag with costume jewelry inside, not the cover up. The bag was labelled booboo coverup. I contacted Amazon who sent message to seller. With other product errors that Amazon contacted the seller I never have heard back from the seller. This company, BooBooCoverUp, however did contact me and apologized, saying it must have been an amazon packaging problem. They said they themselves would send me the product by mail. I just received it. Not only did they include a handwritten note regretting my inconvenience but enclosed an extra free tube. AMAZING customer service by this company.
As for the product--I am a very active senior who takes a baby aspirin everyday. I'm always banging something resulting in big purple bruises. Playing golf or interacting with other people I hear "What happened to you", referring to the bruise(s). This cover up hides them and blends in very well, barely noticeable. I would highly recommend it.

title: Vonpri Silicone Squeeze Bottles
text:
Many people have made comments about issues with putting certain liquids/gels in the bottles. An insert (photos attached) came with the bottles and Item 2 under Tips states
"Traveling bottles are not suitable for Hair Serums, Alcohols, Salicylic Acid, Hydrogen Peroxide, and
Caustic, Corrosive or Flammable products."
Many hair and facial products contain alcohol and such products should not be stored in these bottles according to the insert. I did not see this in the original posting prior to my purchase. I imagine the same was true for those people with complaints. This information should be part of the item description. I hope this information helps other people in making a decision to purchase or not.

I purchased these in Aug 2021. I have given them only 3 stars because I have not yet used them. I plan to update this review after a few uses. However, I wanted to quickly provide photos of the insert that came with the bottles.

title: Decent Hairties for someone who loses them all
text:
I am an extremely forgetful person and I shed more hair ties than I do hair. I'll buy a 10 or 20 pack and they only last me a month because I just leave them everywhere or they magically disappear into the ether. So, to try to make my life easier and save money, I thought these soft no-tug hair ties in a huge quantity would be a decent idea.

At first I hated them. I thought they were really loose, hard to cinch up good, and slipped off my hair easily, but after a week or so of learning how to use them I really love them. I wish they were either slightly bigger or slightly more stretchy as sometimes getting the last loop over my bun can be difficult, but I love that with these hair ties I never have a giant ball of hair attached to the glue on the tie like I used to with conventional no tear hair ties. They also look very sleek and masculine, and it's easy to wear one on your wrist without it looking like a hair tie per se - just like a weird ribbon bracelet.

Overall, they feel cheap, but they get the job done and I don't feel bad about losing them all because I have a giant bag of them at home I can use. 4/5 - Great product, would recommend!

title: Great quality, works great for thick,long,curly hair, and works wonders
text: This is my second set of these brushes I originally got these for my middle daughter and we keep one in her bathroom and one in the kitchen for the times I put a hair mask in her hair and use these combs to get the tangles out and the product into each part of her hair up to her root. So when my oldest seen these and I used them in her hair she was like ok I want one now too and then I also thought these would be great for my son who also has tons of hair and curly hair at that. So now everyone has one and I think I may sadly be getting another set for my daughters when there at their dads house too. They love these brushes and I have to attest using these to comb thru their hair makes things a world easier and less of a hassle I do wish they had a grip on the handle for wet hands but really outside of that I dont have any complaints. These come in packs of 2 and even if you dont have kids using one in a purse and keeping one home is enough reasons to get these especially if you have thick hair these are amazing. My kids are mixed and range from hair length to neck length to butt length and I will tell you these are amazing at handling getting thru those thick tangles. The back has a piece that allows you to have the comb itself at different firmness I like the top one personally it is the firmest level. Overall if I am not a fan I dont know who is but I know for sure I have 4 and I will have 6 by the end of the year.

These hair curlers don’t come with any instructions whatsoever and just in a plastic non resealable bag. Which is a little annoying. The instructions on here aren’t very helpful if you’re a first time user (like me). So I had to look up some videos on how to use them properly. While they work, my hair did get snagged pretty often or tangled in these so I’m not sure if I’ll use them again. Yes my hair was wet and had some gel in it to help the curls form and stay but the tangling and snagging was a huge turn off for me. Maybe it’s just because it was my first time trying them. title: Better Than Metal Ones
text:
As an Asian, I was surprised to see Americans using metal earpick! I tried it once, and boy it was not a pleasant experience. I am used to using wooden earpick - which is more safe and comfortable. Now there are two kinds of wooden earpicks: one is un-coated (like this one) and another is coated. Coated wooden earpick is smoother to maneuver in your ear. So it is up to you - which one you choose. I used both kinds and they are both great for my ears.

As for this particular earpick, it is basic wooden earpick (crafted in Japan, the materials may not have been from Japan). It is a decent quality - not a premium (I have seen and used premium ones. But there is no real difference in use or the effectiveness. It is premium - because it uses better wood). It is easy to maneuver, easy to feel the earwax and remove it, and strong enough to last a long time. For the price (3 ear picks), this is a great choice. So if you have not used wooden earpicks before, then consider this product, you may be pleasantly surprised. Recommended!

title: So disappointed
text: Ordered this after falling in love with it in the sampler.  This full sized product was hard and grainy and difficult to use.  After contacting Ethique directly to ask if there was an issue or of they’d changed the formula because I was extremely disappointed in the product I’d gotten.  They said yes- the lot # I had did have a known problem.  They wanted to send me a replacement.  After giving them all my info, and getting a confirmation email that the order was placed, a month passed and I still had no product and no shipping confirmation.  I emailed Ethique again, and that day a shipping confirmation was sent.  A week later I had the product.  When I opened the box the smell was AWFUL.  Like rancid old Parmesan cheese.  In all, the product in the sampler gave me such wonderful results, but I’m so disappointed in the experience with two of the full sized products that’s dont even know if I’m going to give it another try.  At $28 plus shipping, it’s not cheap.  And the inconsistency makes me weary of the company’s ability to serve us in the US well, bc it doesn’t seem that they have any sort of quality assurances or controls in place for their manufacturing or shipping methods.

title: Save time with Semi-Permanent Eyebrows
text: I don't know why I just found out about this now. I've been pencil shading in my eyebrows everyday for 22 years. This product is amazing! It tint last about 1 week before it starts to fade, which is better than shading it in everyday. My eyebrows are what I spend the most time on when I'm doing my makeup so when I saw this, I had to try it for myself. One capsule is a lot of powder so I only use 1/3 of it w/ an equal amount of developer for both eyebrows. The package comes with a eyebrow brush and the application is easy. If you accidentally get the tint on the outside of your brows, just quickly wipe it off with a damp q-tip. I suggest going on YouTube to get some tips on how to apply it before actually putting it on yourself. I definitely recommend this product. It's pretty awesome! :-)

title: Es buena, trae instructivo detallado.
text: [[VIDEOID:ee381ae32ed3952623ee5f921df764d6]] La he estado utilizando ya un mes. En especial en la zona de las piernas, axilas y zona íntima. Aclaro que yo tuve tratamiento láser durante meses pero lo dejé, y medio año después compré está depiladora. Bien, pues en las piernas si he visto cambios después de la tercera semana de uso, la utilizo dos veces a la semana, los bellos casi ya no salen y los poros de la piel se han hecho chicos, ya casi ni necesito rasurarme. PERO, por otro lado, he visto pocos resultados en la zona íntima y en las axilas, posiblemente es debido a que el bello es más grueso. Actualizaré dentro de unos meses más, estoy segura que esas zonas son más complicadas por las raíces más fuertes. Me gustó la depiladora, si la recomiendo, es cómoda y práctica, no te lleva más de media hora depilarte las piernas, las axilas y la zona íntima, si se calienta déjala reposar hasta que se enfríe, esto para nivel 4 y 5. TRAE unos lentes y un rastrillo en conjunto con la depiladora, además de un instructivo. ACLARO que después de que uses la depiladora, debes de cubrir esa zona por un día, no dejes que le pegue el sol ni te pongas cremas ni nada, esto es recomendación de una dermatóloga, pueden aparecer manchas si no lo haces y puedes herir tu piel, utiliza los lentes y no uses la depiladora en zonas con cortadas o sangre, tampoco debes usar ninguna crema o ungüento cuando estés usando la depiladora. LA RECOMIENDO.

title: I can not stress enough!  I LOVE THESE BRUSHES!!!
text:
I can not stress this enough! I LOVE THESE BRUSHES!

Immediately when I opened the package I started falling inlove. The clutch they come in is amazing. It is white and gold! It is very soft and feels very durable. It would be awesome for traveling or everyday storage. I purchased the white set. They look so expensive! The handle is solid and they are very well made. Initially the clutch has a slight smell. It faded away. The brushes did not have a smell.

I washed the brushes as I would any other brush before using them. No brush hair fell out during washing. They are super soft. I can not explain. They almost seem like velvet. They feel so "high end!"

I absolutely love the variety of big brushes. I love them all. My favorite is the flat top brush. It is amazing at applying foundation. It was flawless. I used them for applying powder, bronzer, blush and I was so impressed.

I definitely like the smaller brushes also. To me they are larger then I like for shadow. However I really liked using them for concealer, highlight, contouring, and setting my under eye powder.

After several days of usage not one brush hair has fallen out! These are my everyday go to brushes!

title: Great for what we need
text:
These are Good for our needs. I use nail wraps for more than just nails.

My son has a medical device (dex cgm) that includes a sensor attached to his body that is a little bigger than the larger nail wraps. It gets boring and it's nice to change up how it looks a bit. The larger nail wraps do a great job of changing it up and adding a little fun at times to the dull medical device.

These nail wraps are a little smaller then others we've had so they don't cover the entire sensor quite as thoroughly as others we've used, but it's decent.

Nail wraps work much better than stickers or things like that. Nail wraps look more like they are painted on, like they belong there vs stickers. Plus this devices gets a lot of wear and sticks don't last and look awful quickly. We also typically cover the sensor with a clear tape and it sticks to stickers and so even covered they come off as soon as the tape is removed. Nail wraps, are more oa nail polish and last a long time - they can last a few months if you don't decided the change it sooner.

While the Tattify wraps are a little small, I LOVE that they offer a lot of boy and make teen appropriate designs. The hard part of changing the look of medical devices has always been finding designs that a boy and especially a mail teen likes.

The second use - we have a teen daughter. Our son gets the bigger ones for his sensor, our daughter gets the small ones for her nails. It's a great double use and win win all around.

I LOVE the monopoly symbols. My 17 year old really likes this one.

I received this product at a discount in exchange for an honest review.

title: Much Improved Frizziness and More!
text:
Yes! Finally! A way to get this dry curly hair under control! I have used the Sauce deep conditioner for about a month or so and used it 3-4 times a week after my hair stylist said that my hair was super dry. Well, I just went back to the hair stylist and we went from “super dry” to “a little dry”! I notice a softer feel and my frizz has been cut in half from where it was! I also notice that my curly hair is not nearly as big when I on occasion have to brush it out as it had been (curly hair girls know what I mean!!). I just bought a second container so that I am prepared when the first container is emptied. I expect my hair to go from “a little dry” to “super healthy” soon! Thank you, Sauce!
Side note: at one point after about a month my hair did need a break because it felt good but looked a little dull. But that could have come from going back to work and using products again and other things-nothing a clarifying shampoo or break every now and then can’t fix and honestly can’t say it was the product so I didn’t dock points.

title: Lovely hair sticks
text: I bought these hair sticks for my daughter who has very thick long hair. (Photos attached) They are beautiful and she loves them and is wearing one pretty much everyday since she got them. The seller enclosed a note advising not to use the hair stick as a lever to create the hairstyle because that pressure could break it which would be understandable because it is a wooden stick. My daughter does her up-do's with her hands though and only inserts the stick to hold her completed look so these sticks have been perfect for her. These are really pretty and make a lovely gift for anyone with long hair. I purchased the set of 3 wood sticks but the seller kindly enclosed a sample of one of the colored aluminum sticks for us to try and I'm so glad he did. I was hesitant to purchase an aluminum stick because I thought it might be hollow and cheap looking- it isn't at all! These are nicely made and weighted and my daughter has asked for more of the aluminum sticks in a variety of colors so I am back to place another order. I wanted to take the time to leave a review because not only is the product pretty, well made and arrived fast,  but I also appreciate the thoughtfulness of the seller and the way he conducts business with integrity. You definately have a happy repeat customer now with us and I would reccomend this product & seller to anyone.

title: Arrived in good shape and everything was there.
text: [[VIDEOID:c9b162d718d7e6d6a3a406d3797c1d79]] There were 2 boxes of nail holders and 10 fingers for nails. The nail stands have a good magnetic pull and fit perfectly in a nail lamp with a bottom attached. The fingers were a hard plastic and were about the size of my pinkie. I expected that from reading the reviews for all different brands though. I haven't used the fingers yet, so I don't know how well they work, but I know from other reviews I'll need to file the nail part to get a good adhesion first. The nail stand works great but I don't love the silver color, it looks cheap and will probably chip off quickly. I'd prefer black or white instead but that wasn't an option with this bundle but it's not a deal breaker here. My only complaint is that the nail stands are very narrow and they tip over one the sides so easily as I put the stand in and out of the uv/led lamp. It's smudged a couple nails in the process. If the base was slightly wider at the bottom it would not be able to tip. I'll probably just hot glue them to something sturdy and flat since almost all those types of stands are like that anyways. It was a good value and I'd buy it again.

title: Best solution for weak nails
text: This is the first product of many I've tried that actually fulfills what it promises to help strengthen nails. It's definitely not the least expensive solution, but far outperforms everything else that has been recommended to me--and there have been many. After many years of 2x a month nail appointments, I stopped getting them done at the beginning of the pandemic. As they grew out, they were thin and weak and tore practically just by looking at them. Using the Vutier serum as directed, after a few weeks, the improvement is impressive. It comes in a mascara-like tube and is easy to brush on neatly and without waste. I would recommend this product to anyone trying to get or keep their nails strong and healthy.

title: You still pump to spray but great product. Fits what I needed
text:
This is exactly what I needed. I have a chameleon and I bought the push down from the top to pump type of continuous sprayer and it absolutely soaks everything down to a ridiculous degree. With this it's much finer mist, something my chameleon likes better. It doesn't freak him out like the other type and he quickly heads to his spot to get misted down.

One gripe I could have was I was wondering how this product works if you don't continually pump it. How could a non-powered sprayer continually spray off of one pump?.. Well you do still pump it.... It's less difficult than your typical pump sprayer absolutely, but you still pump each time to spray. Each pump though will spray for a short period of time before cutting off, maybe half a second to a second after fully depressing the handle if you pressed in one fluid motion.

I like it. I actually ordered this first and cancelled once I'd gone to the store and found the other sprayer I've mentioned. Now I wish I would've just stuck with this instead of wasting my money and having to order it again

text: After reading a lot of reviews and watching review videos on these hair extensions I decided these would be the best ones for me. I’m glad I made the decision to purchase these. The hair seems to be of good quality. They are shiny and very soft. The thickness of the hair is a lot better than other extensions I’ve bought. I notice with other extensions I’ve used there’s hair loss when brushing them out for the first time. That wasn’t the case with these extensions. I ordered two packs of hair and there was plenty of hair. I could have even ordered one pack and they would still give my hair the thickness I’m going for. I don’t notice much of a difference with them being seamless, I could still somewhat see the clips through my natural hair in the crown area. The silicone strips did adhere better so I didn’t have to tease the roots of my hair so much. Although I customize my own hair color by mixing several different colors, the color of the extensions match my hair perfectly. I love these hair extensions and would definitely recommend them to anyone looking to purchase hair extensions.

title: LONG THICK HAIR - BEST ROUND BRUSH EVER
text: I have very long and very thick hair ... I don't always have full use of my hands due to disability so this was taking a real chance - even before my disability I've always had hair down to almost my bottom ... and at the shortest, to the edges of my shoulder blades (middle of my back) ... THIS BRUSH did NOT tangle my hair - this brush actually went through my thick hair and gave it body and allowed me to flip at the ends and where I wanted .... for me to have some height and shape - takes a lot and can be painful for me ... until I got this brush I mostly let my hair air dry and let it go wavy ... then used a curling iron .. but I like to wear my hair straight - with some "sas" .... this brush helps me in that ... it does not tear up my scalp or hurt .... it does let me use it without causing pain to my disabled hands (nerve damage from neck) ... and being able to use the brush more easily than most, I can dry my hair all the way, leaving it to look shinny and healthy and I'm so glad.  I've NEVER had a round brush that has done this .. and at such an inexpensive price ... I've spent up to $70 on hair brushes in the past .... just to make my life easier ...(not recently but way back before I was disabled) ... None of the brushes worked as well as this and I could not recommend it well enough.  I was so surprised!  Also - With a recent really really really bad hair cut ... ugh ... .this brush made it so much easier to work with my hair ...  I'm grateful to have it.

title: Perfect for DIY sheet masks!
text:
I love these!
I had read about doing lotion masks using cotton pads that peeled apart into layers, and bought the stuff to try it. It's good, and not hard to do, but takes a bit of time to prepare. So I bought these compressed sheet masks for doing quick lotion masks. I really like these. The compressed size makes it easy to travel with them, and they don't take up hardly any space when you store them. When you get them wet, they expand like the snake pellets you get on 4th of July. =)
I keep a shot glass in my bathroom just for doing quick lotion masks. I unwrap one of these compressed masks, toss it in the shot glass, then douse it with skin conditioner, hyaluronic acid lotion, and a bit of rose water. Once the mask is nice and saturated, I put it on my face for 3-5 minutes. (Since I like to listen to music while I'm getting ready, I leave the mask on for about the length of a song.)
The cotton material feels nice, not scratchy. When the sheet is wet it has enough stretch to cling to the face like it should. The fit is wide, the the nose flap is short. At least that's the fit on my face. I fix this by carefully cutting the excess width at my temples with scissors and placing one of strips I've cut over the end of my nose where the nose flap doesn't cover. The main thing I like about these is that the flaps on the eye holes are attached at the top. So, while I'm wearing the sheet mask, I can put the eye flaps on my eye lids so they get some moisture and still see what I'm doing. I really like that.
I plan on repurchasing these as soon as I run out.

title: Very pleased with the product
text:
I was a bit skeptical about weather this product would help me, but I'm glad I tried it. I am 52 and have some crow's feet and forehead wrinkles and generally not great skin tone. This product has really helped the appearance of my skin. The improvement was noticed after the first use, mostly an improvement in the tone,brightness, and smoothness of my skin. After using the product 3-4 times a week for a couple months, the forehead lines and crows feet are still visible, but much less pronounced. It also seems to have help the firmness of my neck, which is starting to look a bit saggy.

Another tip: after using the pad on my face, I use it to smooth my knees, feet, and ankles to prepare for self-tanning lotion. Follow up with a good moisturizing lotion before applying the self-tanner. Results are smooth and naturally-looking. I use one of the gradual self-tanners designed to be used every time you moisturize, but I only use it every couple days or so, just for a little color.

title: THIS STUFF WORKS FOR DEMODEX MITES & ROSACEA
text: I started using this after being prescribed 2 prescriptions for Rosacea...1 of them costing me $142 (Ivermectin). I didn't see great results with either Rx. I got smart and researched the cause of Rosacea. These demodex mites that your skin is allergic to causes Rosacea. I have been using this facial wash for about 2 weeks now. I notices a BIG difference within 2 days. I also noticed my face didn't have these little biting sensations, which I get on my scalp and arms. I used it on my arms and the biting went away. I have used this in conjunction with OVANTE SHAMPOO. I used the shampoo 2x/day for 5 days and man has it done a wonderful job. The smell isn't that great but I don't care...it's not terrible and it's obviously killing the mites. Be careful to not use any other moisturizers because it clogs your pores. I only use moisturizer on my neck, chin and forehead now.  I have also just started using a Tea Tree Oil body wash. It seems to help. I can't believe my doctor never mentioned this stuff....it works better than the Rx for me. I know not 1 thing works for everyone but I was getting Rosacea postules and redness on nose and cheeks so bad. Not anymore...it has been cleared up.  I do watch what triggers my rosacea...chocolate and alcohol. But using this facial wash has helped so I can have a little of chocolate and alcohol without having terrible redness the next morning. Y'all PLEASE try this stuff. It's worth it.

title: Excellent value!
text:
When I bought a bottle of SunLabs self tanner to try, I decided to upgrade my mitt too!

Previously, I was using a cheap ULTA brand one that I picked up when I first got into self tanning. This tanning mitt from SunLabs is seriously a step above, and for around the same price!

I like that it is black, so it doesn’t show staining like my ULTA one, and it has a fine but dense velvety texture, not a sponge-y one, so things go on so smooth and streak-free without the mitt soaking up all the product.

I also appreciate that it’s shaped more like a glove, so it doesn’t just slide around when I rub, and that it’s lined! Under my ULTA mitt, I had to wear a latex glove b/c product would seep through so badly my palms would stain. I haven’t had that problem at all with this mitt.

Overall, I would def recommend buying this mitt, or picking up one of the SunLabs bundles where it’s included.

title: HOLY GRAIL
text: Simply Amazing. I have extremely oily acne-prone skin and this is by far one of the best makeup toner/primers I have used. It does make the skin feel slightly tight once it dried, which to some may be slightly uncomfortable. Doesn't really have much of a smell and keeps my makeup looking fresh all day long. I still get slightly oily, but I figured that would be expected with my skin type. This has worked so much better at keeping my makeup looking fresh than anything in a high-end makeup store would. Way better than the Urban Decay primer's I have tried which run around $40. For only $8 this is a total steal and if you have oily skin or plan on wearing makeup to a swimming event I highly recommend this stuff. I have applied makup over this and submerged my face fully in water and the majority of my makeup was still on. Simply wonderful. 10/10 would recommend to everyone and their mom.

title: Great results after I read and followed the instructions!
text:
I am a 63 year old woman with mild to moderate adult acne. Sometimes, when I find a new hopeful product, I am so desperate for it to work that I overdo everything. For example, had I read Vi-Tae’s President/Founders “Helpful Tips”, I would not have left it on longer than 2-3 minutes and I would not have used my electric application brush, which was not disastrous, but I definitely did not get the best possible results. Great results after I read and followed the instructions!
It has taken me longer to get back to Amazon and Vi-Tae, because I did not read all of the information first. I got the Vi-Tae, ‘More Than Clean’ and dove ahead after skimming the instructions. Now that I have heard from Elizabeth Robinson, President, Vi-Tae, Inc., twice – I had to step back, start over and do it right. I know overdoing any product just exacerbates my face situation and one would think I should have learned my lesson, but nooooo.
So anyway, I am using the product correctly now! I am noticing, the first time ever – my nose pores are getting smaller and my face – miracle of miracles, is clearing up. It almost makes me cry to think I can wake up and not have new breakouts.
I will purchase the product again and I will continue to use as directed. Thank you Elizabeth for being persistent and to anyone purchasing this product – read the directions and follow them the first time and you will not be disappointed.
Victoria

title: In a Hurry, need a perfect top knot in seconds? You found the right product!
text:
I used to own snap bracelet type bun maker when I was younger. The snap bracelet structure was enclosed with fabric and eventually the pocket enclosing them in soft fabric broke and it did not last. This version of the prefect bun maker does not use fabric to enclose. I imagine if and when the product fails superglue and/or replacement fabric (used in three places) would repair to new condition again. Considering the price invested and the time to fix you might as well buy some more. Overall just what I was looking for, but actually better!

Pros: (1) Quick and Easy bun, (2) Fashionable looking Top Knot, (3) Price is good while remaining functional, (4) Great for getting your hair up and out of the way, (5) Better construction than the item I came to Amazon to search for.

Cons: (1) Designed for shoulder length to long hair (do not buy if you have short hair). (2) snap bracelet technology is enclosed with strings similar to hair, but the ends may be weak link over time (IF they fail later down the road could be easily fixed with superglue ... or just buy new ones).

title: My Favorite Cushion
text:
I really like this cushion foundation! It has a natural finish and can hardly be detected. It can actually be customized by if you use it right out of the package with a dewy finish or turn the sponge over for a more matte finish. I was disappointed with the color to be honest. I had heard Korean face makeup was a lot lighter than the ones here in the states but I've found them to just be a tad too dark still for me. This one was actually a lot darker than some of the other ones and much warmer, but I can still get away with it. In all honestly this would be a great foundation then for most people who want to try Korean BB cushions because of the color so I highly recommend! All I did was put in my usual white foundation mixer and now it's perfect.

The cushion case itself is actually the best part and I plan to use it long after the foundation itself is used up.

I took off a star because of the fragrance. I must admit for someone with as sensitive skin as I do I can still wear this without irritation so I still recommend it for people with skin like mine. However, if you're also sensitive to scents as I am, then I wouldn't recommend. It's actually rather light compared to other Korean products that are heavily perfumed, but still has a perfume scent. I'm actually quite disappointed that Korean beauty companies choose to put such fake perfume scents into their products and hinders me from using most. Again, this one is light and gentle enough that even I can use it!

title: Best deodorant ever. Keeps you smelling good.
text: This is the best deodorant I have ever used. After some weeks of using it I noticed, in retrospect, that the deodorants with aluminum caused me to smell worse when sweating. This deodorant doesn't stop you from sweating, so this was something I had to get used to, and some people might want to consider. I am someone who sweats a lot, regardless nateur keeps me smelling good during the day. However, after a hike of 8 miles I did have to reapply. That for me is reasonable. Also, if I'm under lots of stress I keep it in my bag to reapply during the day. Until now, I have to only reapply it once during the day, if I sweat too much. To some of you that might get some rash on the armpits. In my experience, I got some rash during my second or third week of use, but it went away without me doing anything about it. Everyone is different though. I would say that this deodorant can leave a clear residue on the part of your garments close to the armpits. This has been of no problem to me as it goes away easily. When it happens on my cotton blouses, I hand wash the spot and goes away like nothing with light scrubbing. Even with this in consideration I find the performance of the deodorant exceptional. It keeps me smelling good better than any other deodorant I have tried be it all natural or with aluminum. Also, the fragrance is lovely.

title: Came in the mail just as pictured!!
text:
Before i talk about my purchase, i just want to say i had bought this hair at a discount.

First off i wanna say the shipping was so fast that i had received it within 5 days. This was such a great surprise because i am so impatient when waiting for a package. Secondly the hair came packaged just as the picture looked. The hair was wrapped with the pink paper which says "Unprocessed Virgin Human Hair". The only down fall i noticed was when i unraveled the hair it seemed a bit thinner on the ends than toward the weft. But this is also true of my own hair. Also each length came individually packaged in its own bag. This was excellent so the hair wouldn't get tangled with each other. It doesn't have any weird smell or any lice. Over all this was a great purchase. I feel like the seller was honest about the description and wasn't misleading at all. I will definitely write another review after i have made my wig out of this hair.

title: Works Great!
text: My nails always lift, whether gel or dip, around the cuticle, but the middle of the nail sticks well, causing damage sometimes, if I pick at them, or one pops off. I purchased this product after reading some reviews, to use under my dip powder manicures. I use it only in the middle of my nail, all the way to the tip. Now, when my nails lift around the cuticle, if I'm ready for a new mani, I can easily remove them, without damaging my natural nail. About a week into my mani, I'm able to do this without soaking, just when I'm tired of the color and seeing some new growth anyway! Definitely works well for me! And, shipping was VERY fast, although Amazon said it would take a week or more.

title: Antioxidant face lotion combined with broad spectrum sun protection
text:
I have been looking for a broad spectrum daily face lotion/sunscreen for a long time. I read through all 27 "Best Moisturizers with SPF" on the Environmental Working Group's 2012 list and this Badger one seems promising.
--- INGREDIENTS ---
The lotion aspect is packed with all natural plant derived ingredients some with antioxidant abilities. The sun screen aspect provides broad spectrum UVA/UVB protection through a physical agent zinc oxide not a chemical agent; further, the zinc oxide used are non-nano sized at about 600nm and the Badger website provides a chart showing the size distributions of their ZnO particles.
--- USAGE ---
In terms of usage, I have been using this every other day for about a week. It glides on smoothly and has a light pleasant fragrance. It makes my skin feel soft and does not make my face whitish at all.
--- EFFECTIVENESS ---
I have not been exposed to the sun for more than 20 minutes at a time yet while having this product on my face. Will try to update review once I have more data.

I am slightly concerned with the relatively low SPF (16) compared to other daily sunscreens hence the 4 stars. But at the same time I did not want to have loads of sunscreen agents pasted on my face all day. So it's a trade-off.

Another product that may be promising with higher SPF (30) is Suntegrity Skincare All Natural Moisturizing Face Protection. However its ZnO particles are smaller at 220nm, but still non-nano by a long shot. Also it's about 1.5 times the unit price as this Badger one.

title: Unpleasant tenacious masculine scent and grainy texture
text: I ordered this deodorant in Citrus Gardens but could not detect much citrus scent. I am female and hoped the citrus scent would be fresh but not too "girly" to share with a man. Unfortunately it smelled quite unpleasant and overwhelmingly to my nose of something like ginger (which is not listed among the ingredients) that stubbornly clung to my skin despite repeated attempts to wash it off and left the area a bit raw and irritated. The packaging is attractive and solid but the product texture seemed "grainy" and dragged uncomfortably along my skin upon application. I passed it along to a young man who is allergic to conventional antiperspirant/deodorant products and hoped he might enjoy the masculine scent and be less particular than I was about the application and texture.

title: Works on psoriasis!
text:
Bare with me as I tell my life's story on why I picked this product. I promise reading the whole thing might help you make an informed decision. I did some research before purchasing this soap because the psoriasis by my eyes had been increasingly getting worse. My skin was red, sensitive, flaking, and cracking open. My psoriasis had also been spreading into my cheeks and forehead from around my eyes. I have had eczema in my scalp since I was an infant, which turned into psoriasis, as an adult. I have it on my hands too. The dermatologists prescribed medications weren't working to my satisfaction. I decided to order a bunch of different dead sea salt products to test the one that would work best for me. Dead sea salt, based on my research, can help with the inflammation and dead skin.

Now to the review on this particular product:
Out of the sea salt scrub (tried it and I'm still on the fence) and mud mask (I haven't tried it yet), this soap bar is my favorite. It works!! I have to say bar, as in one, because so far I'm still working on using the dead sea salt/mud soap bar. If the other bars work equally as well, then this bundle soap is the best deal that I have found. I used the soap bar everyday for a week and I saw significant decreases in all the aforementioned symptoms. I don't have pictures because I'm embarrassed on how badly my psoriasis made my face look. The first week I had a pimple flair up, I think that's pretty normal when using a new product. As far as I know, this company doesn't have moisturizers. My recommendation if you use this soap on psoriasis, get a decent moisturizer too. The soap helps but it leaves the skin a little dry. It's not a bad thing. It just makes your face feel tight. I usually wash my face using the soap before I go to bed. I can then apply a moisturizer in the morning to help with my dry skin. I hope if you choose to purchase this product, that it works for you like it did for me. If you have psoriasis, don't give up and keep trying. Do some research on your skins needs before purchasing any product!

title: Best Hair Waver Ever
text:
Ok - ignore the part in amazon description that calls this a scrimper. It is NOT. It was has three large barrels that create waves. Beautiful waves that last for days in some hair. Both my daughter and I love this product. The waves in her hair last several days. I have very fine hair so I need high heat and my waves make it through one day in tact. I don't use the glove, it's just ornery. Nor do we need the scrunchies. With these kind of waves, you want to wear your hair down and show off your glow! Note - with high heat you must must must use a heat protecting product on your hair first! I recommend Boost It Blow Out Heat Spray. Works on dry hair when using heating products despite its name. I'm warning you now, that with this wave wand, it is possible to burn your hair. And that smell lingers until you wash it.

Regardless this is still our favorite hair tool right now!

title: Magic in a bottle!!!
text:
You can't find a better quality oil, especially at this price! I've tried all brands of essential oils and these are truly the real deal! They are strong but not overpowering where it would cause a headache.
I wear the oils daily and everyone compliments how lovely they smell. I only put 2 drops on each wrist and it last all day! I am very sensitive and this is the only brand that doesn't irritate. No carrier oil is even needed. I clean with these oils, add them to my carpet cleaner, put a few drops in my laundry load, I use them in a diffuser and the overall mood in the house is calming and relaxing(what we needed with all this Covid stuff!) and those paver ants that are impossible to rid are gone! I spray around the house using the peppermint and lavender and those huge spiders that appear spring/summer no longer linger, and we live next to the lake where there's a ton! The deer stopped eating my flowers. These will not disappoint!
The oils are a 5 star product, however the cinnamon oil was leaking. That is why I gave this package a 4 star. Despite that, I will order again. It's worth it!

title: Splat vs. MP
text:
Ok. So let me start by saying that until last month I had virgin hair. I went to a professional stylist to get my tips dyed rainbow colors. He used 3 different brands. One had stayed in nicely, the other two washed out in one wash with color safe shampoo and I was left with bleached tips and some random blue strands. So I decided to do it myself. I read all the reviews for both splat and Manic Panic and the tips from people who had used them before purchasing 4 colors of Splat and 2 colors of Manic Panic. I used splat beach however because there were several tips that my stylist had left untouched. I have black hair and the bleach lightened it to a medium blonde in about an hour (I wrapped the tips in tin foil to keep it off my skin) plus it didn't fry my hair! I then colored chunks of hair in random order using all 6 dyes. I wrapped the tips in tin foil again, put a plastic bag over my head and waited 3 hours. After removing the tin foil and washing my hair in cold water (which ran clear after 5 minutes at the most) I towel dryed my hair (the towel wasn't stained) and lo and behold. All the splat colors were vibrant and beautiful and one of the MP colors didn't even turn out. Those chunks are still bleach blonde. I love this stuff.
Now then. A few things to note. Even with 6 color packets on my counter I didn't make a mess. Nothing got stained. Nothing dripped. I just used latex gloves and a whole lotta patience. The stuff is pretty thick so if you're careful you can do this without staining your forehead :)

title: A Great Shave
text:
First off let me start off by saying that like most 17 year old males, I have very sensitive skin. Before buying the Norelco Advantage, I could not find a simple solution to getting a nice quick shave without all the hassle that comes along with it. I did not really have a problem at the time, with the length of time that shaving took, but rather, the razor-burn afterwards. I went through about 10-12 different types of creams, and 6-7 different razors, trying to find the right combination. It wasn't until a good friend of mine recommended this, that I decided to try an electric razor. The Norelco definately lived up to it's reputation, as one of the best electric razors out there. Two things that stuck out about it was that you could get a good clean shave in hardly any time at all, and in my case, the gel worked wonders on my previous razor burn.

Now, there are however a few things that could have been improved on. None of these however seriously demote the quality of this razor. The first thing that I noticed is that it is not good with multiple day stubble. If I go for a few days without shaving, I end up having to switch to the beard trimmer, and then back again to the regular blade, in order to get a good shave. This can get quite tedious and annoying in a hurry. Another thing that I noticed is that the blades tend to gunk up quite easily making cleaning almost a weekly thing. The last thing is that unless at full charge, the blades tend miss some of the longer hairs.

All around this is a great product for those of you out there who are looking for a nice quick close shave. Dollar for dollar this is one of the better products that I have bought, but I look foward to seeing an upgrade on this Electric.

title: Mom Loves It
text: Bought this for my mother to go with a necklace that I bought her for Christmas this year. Mom had complained about the delicate chain and clasp on a necklace that I had previously given to her and so I decided to give the Clever Clasp a try for this year's gift.  She actually called me from Florida when she received the necklace with the Clever Clasp already in place to complain that the clasp didn't work (although I had sent the instructions for working the clasp with the necklace).  After going over how the clasp worked and realizing that she was doing it correctly, I encouraged her to "pull harder" on the two sides of the magnet.  She reluctantly pulled harder and pulled the magnets apart.  She was pleased and amazed at the strong pull of the magnets.  She's now regularly wearing the necklace that I sent previously, as well as the new one.

title: Hair and scalp feel cleaner and healthier!
text:
I actually got this as a test product though the a different site. I have only used this product twice and have started to see small changes in my happyy and scalp. I suffer deal with dry scalp and severe dandruff. Lately I have noticed that my scalp does not itch and I have not seen any dandruff flakes. For me this is an improvement! Secondly, My make and scalp look and feel healthier as a result of using this product. I have also started to notice that my the happen on my gate and head are showing some small signs of GRADUALLY getting darker.

One reviewer mentioned not using the sosp because of how it smells and they did not want their hair smelling that way. I can tell you from my experience that it leaves no scent. My hair smelling clean.

Patience is key with any product. Results are never instantaneous and always take time to happen. Just remember we are all different and any natural product works differently for different people.

title: Terrible
text: I've been a user of Norelco products for over 15 years and have been extremely happy with their older models. This product, however, is a total disappointment and should be an embarrassment to this company. I dread having to use this product and I am actively looking for another company/product as I have lost my trust in Norelco. I received the 1050 as a gift by the way and I would have never purchased this product based on the generally negative reviews and the obnoxious price tag. It seems like Norelco has spent a great deal of effort making the 1050 look good, but not necessarily function well. Putting the moronic charger design aside (the shaver nestles deep into the charger jacket and there is no easy way of clawing it out without hurting your finger tips), the blades and motor itself seem to lack enough power to perform a basic shave. Dont have time to shave for a day or two? Minor stubble will often lead to snagging, causing a great deal of pain and discomfort. The jaw line and neck require numerous passes to shave, which causes lots of irritation by the end of the shave. Same goes for the sideburn trimmer, which is difficult to use since it so close to the head (difficult to see where the blades are) and it severely underperforms. All in all, it's best to do more research and find a better product.

title: WHAT IS THIS VOODOO?
text:
Firstly, I RARELY review products... because I'm lazy, what can I say. HOWEVER, this product could not go without one.

Come along for the ride.

Recently, I lost a lot of hair due to anxiety and grief. It was like adding insult to injury when finally I noticed how profound it really was. I used to have very full, healthy hair and though I have highlights, I take very good care of it - heat protectants, salon shampoo/conditioner... you get the gist. I had been using "It's a 10 Silk Express" thinking it had heat protectant properties like the regular "It's a 10" but nay nay!! For 2-3 months I had been using a curling iron with no protectant! However, since I don’t curl my hair often I’ve never seen this kind of breakage so what was going on?! I knew the leave in wasn’t doing me any favors so I looked to my curling iron. I raise the clamp on it and noticed that it had burned completely through it's tourmaline coating underneath - in other words, the temperature control was jacked and getting way too hot. (FU Hosan curling iron that I bought on Amazon). I never noticed because how often do you look underneath the clamp? My nearly all one length hair down to the the middle of my back now had several pieces 3-4" long and some areas even less. To top it off, my hair was now incredibly dry and damaged. To say I was devastated would be a MASSIVE understatement.

In an attempt at damage control I set about trying to find something that would tame the frizz, make my hair soft, and would be healthy for my scalp. I will tell you I tried SEVERAL products and spent so much $$ in doing so only to have my fine hair feel weighed down or still a matted, dry mess. Joico Defy Damage Mask, Redken, Olaplex... none of them helped. Then I stumbled upon this product. Truth be told, I wasn't looking for it. I read a review online about a peppermint shampoo that was really good and would leave my hair feeling soft. (They say peppermint can help with trying to grow hair as it invigorates the scalp and increases blood flow to the follicles.) I was skeptical but was willing to give it a shot. THEN, I see this as a "products you might also need" and I was like, oh heck, why not.

My shampoo and mask arrive and first thing, I'm in the shower trying them out. Shampoo? Awesome. Mask? UNFREAKINBELIEVABLE! I was finally able to comb through my hair without a million snags. OK... what?! I let my air dry and let me tell you what, my hair is soooo soft!! I no longer look like Medusa with all the various hair lengths and NO frizz! This stuff is magic! And when you compare it to all the other spendy crap I bought, this stuff easily blows them out of the water.... for so much less. Cherry on top? It's from a small business from TX! YeeHaw!

I can't recommend it enough! Sauce Beauty, you're the bees knees! Don't go changin'!

title: It also works better if you have soaked your feet for a bit ...
text:
This was a little bit taken back in experiencing the way this works because I have never used a motorized file and to me, it seemed temperamental. You can't press down or the rotation stops, so you have to apply it gently and with a light handed touch. (I guess it is just a matter to getting used to how to use this.) Perhaps this is the way due to safety - it lessens the possibility of deep or severe abrasions? Or Maybe that is just the physics of friction and a safety feature.

Applying it gently and lightly is the key. It also works better if you have soaked your feet for a bit to soften thick callused areas. At that point though, when you use this device after soaking, be sure to not leave it on a section for more than a few seconds per pass. Definitely use a foot moisturizer after use, by doing so, the areas I treated were softer and smoother.

It DOES work, but it will take a few uses to truly get rid of thick calluses- it does smooth them and diminish the size, but certainly, it does not rid them in one treatment. The first time I used it on my feet, I only had about five minutes to do this, and it did remove some dead skin (not all) and smoothed out calluses. My guess is that with repeated use (as in two or three times a week), the appearance of my feet will be better and softer. It is better than a pumice stone mechanized by your hand as the effort is less with a motorized device. The roller on this device is akin to a pumice stone, so the roller not flimsy. I have not tried other ones like this to compare this to them. This model package came with an additional roller AND batteries. Keep the clear cover for the roller - for more hygienic storage. It is waterproof, so the roller was easy to wash off between uses.

I might update this after a few more treatments. Overall, I am not disappointed - the price is better than the others, the roller is decent, and I guess I was hoping it would rid of calluses in one treatment.

title: I only wore the chest pad one night. The ...
text: After reading my last review, you kindly sent me at no cost another pair of chest pads.  Only problem is, again there is no polyester bag to protect them in and I am not sure what lining you are talking about.  The instructions state to "store the pad with the protective lining and put it back in the polyester bag".  Is the protective lining the very thin saran wrap that the pad is on when you get it?  What should I be expecting the polyester bag to be?  Polyester is a fabric.  There is noting like that in the box it comes with.  Very disappointing.  I want to use the pad, but not sure how to store it after use without a better explanation.

title: Look kissable!
text: Ok. This really works. I tried this over a few weeks and the best thing is how quickly it works. Just glide it on, feel the tingle, then follow up with lip color. And, now that we don't have to be masked all the time, I want to look kissable again.

title: Didn't get any of the results listed.
text: I purchased this product after reading all the rave reviews and because it's made in the USA but it did nothing for my 69 year-old skin! I was especially looking to improve firmness. I used the product faithfully twice daily as directed using one pump and the product is gone in 5 weeks with no results. Very disappointed :(

The clamp it comes with works great, you can clamp it on to any table. I applied makeup to the doll but it seems like this doll is not made for makeup. Overall my 20" doll is a five star item!!!

title: Weird
text:
I purchased the Lume Bay Rum scent. I opened and used it on freshly clean armpits and I now smell like rotting Christmas tree (really the only way I can describe it).

Time will tell how long my armpits will stay smelling this way (longevity) and whether it will cause any irritation etc.

I cannot recommend (at least) this scent. I wonder if other scents are better?
